title: Data Analyst
description: Chicago Fire Football Club is a Major League Soccer team that was founded in 1997. The Club returned to Soldier Field as well as opened a new 50,000 square foot business office in the heart of the city. With tremendous growth and expansion, the Club is laying the foundation for an ambitious vision that will transform the Club in the coming years. <strong>Position Overview:</strong> Chicago Fire FC is hiring a data analyst to work with the club’s sporting staff. The data analyst will be responsible for delivering data-driven metrics, predictive models, analysis, and visualizations. This position will support Football Operations stakeholders by deriving actionable insights from varied datasets. The analyst will work with colleagues in the analytics department to set data standards and best practices across the club. <strong>Job Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Collaborate with analytics department colleagues to develop models and analyses to inform football operations decision-making</li><li>Contribute to the design and delivery of all analysis support, including training, pre-match, in-game, post-match, individual player support, and scouting/player monitoring</li><li>Present and communicate analyses to appropriate stakeholders</li><li>Ensure all data processes are efficient, reliable and in line with club standards and time frames</li><li>Develop strong working relationships across the multi-disciplinary team</li></ul> <strong>Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related field, or equivalent work experience</li><li>1+ years of data analysis experience</li><li>Demonstrated experience with statistical software (e.g. R, Python) </li><li>Demonstrated experience with SQL and relational databases</li><li>Demonstrated experience analyzing data to support decision-makers or derive insights</li><li>Strong knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning and predictive modeling</li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills and an ability to collaborate with non-technical audiences</li><li>User empathy and a willingness to work directly with football operations personnel</li><li>An understanding of football and desire to learn about football analytics</li><li>Ability to work non-traditional hours, in non-traditional settings, including all home games (or other work events) that fall on nights, weekends, and/or holidays</li><li>Must be fully vaccinated and boosted for COVID-19<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Experience analyzing football data</li><li>Familiarity with data engineering tools and architectures</li><li>An interest in web development and machine learning model deployment</li></ul> <strong>Please note:</strong> <ul><li>Chicago Fire FC is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity, equity, accessibility, and inclusion. Our diversity initiatives start with the recruitment and selection process; therefore, we’d like to welcome all diverse candidates to apply to opportunities within our Club. </li><li>CFFC is committed to providing equal employment opportunity and maintaining a workplace for employees and applicants for employment that is free from discrimination. The Company does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, citizenship, age, veteran or military status, disability, sexual orientation, sexual orientation or expression, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law. This policy governs all aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, compensation, discipline, termination, and access to benefits and training.</li><ul><li>If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, please contact the Human Resources Department at hr@chicagofirefc.com to let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. <br></li></ul></ul><strong><u>MLS Privacy Policy<br></u></strong><ul><li>By clicking apply, you agree to the terms of the MLS Privacy Policy. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Job Questions<br></u></strong><ul><li>Are you legally authorized to work in the United States? </li><li>Will you now or in the future require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B visa status)? </li><li>What is your desired salary range for this position?</li></ul>

title: Data Analyst
description: <strong>Title</strong>: Data Analyst<p><br></p><strong>Location</strong>: Chicago, IL<p><br></p><strong>Duration</strong>: Fulltime<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>candidates who are working or have Data analyst / working with business in getting data requirements and working with the solution/data architects/engineers for the data they collected and analysis it. During the data collection they might be writing some SQL queries to get the data need etc. they need interaction with business data &amp; application teams<p><br></p><strong>Must-Have Skills &amp; Experience:-</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's or master's degree in business, finance, statistics, computer science, or a related field.</li><li>At least 7 plus years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.</li><li>Strong SQL query writing skills and Excel.</li><li>Strong experience in documenting data requirements and source data information.</li><li>Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI</li><li>Strong understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL concepts.</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.</li><li>Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to identify and resolve complex technical issues.</li><li>Attention to detail and ability to work independently and as part of a team.</li></ul> <strong>Nice to Have Skills &amp; Experience:-</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with cloud-based data storage technologies, such SQL Server, Azure cloud storage</li><li>Experience with statistical analysis and data mining techniques.</li><li>Knowledge of data governance and regulatory compliance requirements.</li></ul><p><br></p><em>Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.</em>

title: Deposit Data Quality Analyst
description: At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>Responsible for activities related to deposit account disputes and data furnishing. This role will play an integral part in ensuring compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA). This individual will need to investigate and provide a recommended resolution to consumer report disputes. Additionally, this individual will need to work to validate data contributed to the National Specialty Consumer Reporting Agencies (NSCRAs). Data validation involves critical analysis and interpretation of data relative to system information and transmission files. Finally, this individual may participate and assist in remediation of identified problems or issues. Candidate would preferably have knowledge of FCRA requirements and a strong understanding of deposit accounts a familiarity with reporting of accounts to an NSCRA.<br><br><strong>Preferred Skills/Experience<br><br></strong><ul><li> High school diploma or equivalent</li><li> Two to three years of experience in quality analysis and measurement activities</li><li> Strong knowledge and understanding of the products and services applicable to the assigned area</li><li> Thorough knowledge of the productivity and accuracy standards of the assigned area</li><li> Strong knowledge of computer systems used in the assigned area</li><li> Excellent verbal and written communications skills</li><li> Proficient computer navigation skills using a variety of software packages including Microsoft Office applications<br><br></li></ul>If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.<br><br><strong>Learn how</strong> the way we work at U.S. Bank drives meaningful relationships with our customers and collaboration across the company.<br><br><strong>Benefits:<br><br></strong>Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours):<br><br><ul><li>Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)</li><li>Basic term and optional term life insurance</li><li>Short-term and long-term disability</li><li>Pregnancy disability and parental leave</li><li>401(k) and employer-funded retirement plan</li><li>Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure)</li><li>Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities</li><li>Adoption assistance</li><li>Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law<br><br></li></ul><strong>EEO is the Law<br><br></strong>U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors. Applicants can learn more about the company’s status as an equal opportunity employer by viewing the federal <strong>KNOW YOUR RIGHTS</strong> EEO poster.<br><br><strong>E-Verify<br><br></strong>U.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories. The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services. Learn more about the E-Verify program.<br><br>The salary range reflects figures based on the primary location, which is listed first. The actual range for the role may differ based on the location of the role. In addition to salary, US Bank offers a comprehensive benefits package, including incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase 401k contribution and pension (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Pay Range: $22.74 - $30.34 - $33.37<br><br>U.S. Bank will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

title: Administrative Analyst
description: We are looking for a proactive administrative analyst with strong problem-solving and analytical skills who can help us develop stronger strategies and processes. In this role, you will be required to research current policies, collect information about budgets and procedures, analyze data and processes, and improve or develop new strategies.<br><br>To be a successful administrative analyst, you should be focused on optimizing processes within your department or organization. You should be collaborative, communicative, and creative with strong reasoning and problem-solving skills.<br><br>Administrative Analyst Responsibilities:<br><ul><li>Working in an organization or department to optimize processes and ensure budgets are used effectively.</li><li>Providing internal support for departments that want to increase efficiency, productivity, or profitability.</li><li>Conducting research through surveys and employee interviews, and reviewing processes, budgets, and other information.</li><li>Analyzing data and processes to look for and better understand problems.</li><li>Developing processes and policies to replace or improve upon current methods.</li><li>Working with departments as they implement, refine, review, and modify processes and systems.</li><li>Establishing and enforcing budgets and timelines.</li><li>Presenting findings and pitching ideas to management and other departments so they understand recommendations or changes.</li><li>Ensuring that all initiatives align with the company’s mission and goals.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in finance, business, or a related field.</li><li>At least two years of experience as an administrative analyst or similar.</li><li>Further education and certification are advantageous.</li><li>Strong research, math, and computer skills.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking abilities.</li><li>Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Ability to analyze processes and data.</li><li>Good understanding of financial principles and budgeting.</li><li>Strong leadership abilities.</li></ul>

title: Patient Programs Data Analyst (31697)
description: <strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p>Job Location<p><br></p>Erie Humboldt Park Health and Dental Center - 2750 W. North - Chicago, IL<p><br></p><strong>Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>GENERAL SUMMARY</strong><p><br></p>The Data and Improvement Analyst is responsible for managing data analysis and reporting needs for Erie’s Patient Programs teams, supporting grant reporting, contract/ payor requirements and initiatives, and department and program quality improvement efforts. The Analyst will work closely with department leadership, agency quality leaders, and identified subject matter experts on entry, reporting, and analysis of data as it pertains to operations and clinical quality. In addition, this role will assist in strategizing on potential data needs and solutions with teams throughout Patient Programs, ensuring that these patient-facing services are as efficient and effective as possible.<p><br></p><strong>Principal Duties And Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Partner with department leadership to optimize and improve data collection, monitoring, and reporting for programs</li><li>Refine and manage department centralized data reporting process</li><li>Support department strategic planning through identification of trends, root causes, and opportunities for improvement</li><li>Align agency quality objectives with prioritization for department activities</li><li>Monitor and manage clinical quality dashboards for HIV, HepC, and PrEP programs</li><li>Support planning and facilitation of Lending Hand for Life Clinical Quality Improvement meetings</li><li>Lead data entry and quality assurance for Chicago Department of Public Health and Ryan White reporting; participate in Ryan White funder meetings as data and quality representative. </li><li>Serve as liaison between Patient Programs, Development, Business Intelligence, and EHR Ops teams to validate and manage reports</li><li>Research and assemble information and data, preparing internal and external communication materials for presentations, speaking points, correspondence, and other written materials</li><li>Perform quality assurance on various data reports </li><li>Engages in special projects as assigned</li><li>Other duties as assigned </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong><p><br></p><strong>Skills and Knowledge: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Highly competent in Excel </li><li>Experience using data visualization to communicate outcomes and objectives</li><li>Statistical analysis</li><li>Ability to quickly learn new software and technologies</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication</li><li>Comfort with multitasking with demonstrated organizational skills</li><li>Works well independently and enjoys supporting and interacting with multiple teams</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of 1 year of data entry, management, or analysis experience required </li><li>Experience using Epic EMR system and reporting functionality desirable</li><li>Interest in community health, public health, or health care </li><li>Experience with meeting facilitation, project management, and process improvement strongly preferred Experience using Vizio or other data visualization software helpful but not required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BA or BS degree or equivalent combination of education and relevant work experiences required </li><li>Master’s Degree preferred</li></ul>

title: Data Engineer
description: With thousands of employees worldwide, teamwork and collaboration are valued here.<br><br>We look for employees who are driven, determined and ready to accelerate their future. By joining our team, you will earn competitive pay, benefits, insurance, 401k, pension and more while working in an environment with the highest safety standards in the industry.<br><br><strong><u>The Position<br><br></u></strong><em> The Data Engineer is responsible for expanding and optimizing our current data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The ideal candidate is experienced in both data pipeline creation and data transformation. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, system architects, data analysts and Business Analysts on all data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. They must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems, and products. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s current data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives. <br><br></em><strong><u>Key Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture. </li><li> Assemble complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. </li><li> Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc. </li><li> Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources. </li><li> Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs. </li><li> Keep data separated and secure across all platforms used. </li><li> Work with data and business experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems. </li><li> Other duties as assigned. <br></li></ul><strong>Primary Location<br><br></strong>US-IL-Chicago-Chicago N. LaSalle St.<br><br><strong>Work Locations<br><br></strong>Chicago N. LaSalle St.<br><br><strong>Job<br><br></strong>Information Systems<br><br><strong>Schedule<br><br></strong>Full-time<br><br><strong>Shift<br><br></strong>1st Shift<br><br><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. </li><li> Experience: 5+ years of experience in Data Engineer role </li><li> Skills: Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases. </li><li> Experience building and optimizing data pipelines architectures and data sets. </li><li> Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement. </li><li> Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets. </li><li> Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management. </li><li> A successful history of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from disconnected datasets. </li><li> Project management and organizational skills. </li><li> Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment. </li><li> Experience with relational SQL databases, including MS SQL server, Oracle, DB2, and Maria. </li><li> Experience with Data Cloud platforms like SnowFlake and or Data Bricks. </li><li> Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: SQDR, Airflow, Fivetran, Airbyte, etc. </li><li> Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java </li><li> Travel: 20% at most <br></li></ul><strong><u>Physical Demands/Work Environment<br><br></u></strong>The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.<br><ul><li> Physical demands: While performing duties of job, employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle or feel objects; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close and distance vision. </li><li> Work environment: The noise level in the work environment is usually minimal to moderate. </li><li> Must be willing to work occasional nights and/or weekends as business commitments dictate. <br></li></ul><strong><em>Great Dane is an Equal Opportunity Employer</em></strong>

title: Data Engineer
description: <strong>Opportunity<br><br></strong>Media.Monks is looking for an experienced <strong>Google Analytics Data Specialist</strong> with enterprise-level client facing experience in analytics and implementation of marketing and e-commerce projects. This experience should include helping clients to develop data strategies, complex measurement projects, and experience driving value with expert knowledge and client relationship skills.<br><br>You will be responsible for analytics initiatives, including managing relationships with a number of enterprise clients, building out their analytics framework, overseeing tagging, and ad-hoc reporting needs.<br><br>The ideal candidate <strong>MUST</strong> have a history of working with <strong>Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, </strong>and the <strong>Google Marketing Platform</strong> to help a variety of businesses, overseeing or directly having a hand in the implementation of their data collection, as well as finding ways to utilize this data to drive value for their clients through reporting and analysis.<br><br>This role also offers a huge opportunity for growth within our North America and global data team, the ability to participate in innovation on projects, and the potential to advance the practice of analytics and data from the forefront.<br><br><strong>The Role <br><br></strong><strong>Responsibilities Will Include<br><br></strong><ul><li>Provide subject matter expertise in Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager to your clients via scheduled reports, ad-hoc reports, overseeing the tagging and analytics framework, and a variety of analysis and insight initiatives.</li><li>Develop analytics and data strategies for some of the largest brands in the world with a focus on measurably lifting their business. </li><li>Share your data and marketing analytics expertise with your clients and the MightyHive team; acting as a thought leader for your client, and an active participant in the knowledge growth of the MightyHive team.</li><li>Manage the relationship and projects for enterprise clients</li><li>Assist clients in understanding the importance of online measurement, and provide best practice guidelines for their general data strategy, as well as specific technical implementations.</li><li>Assist the data team in propelling our practice forward with new go to market initiatives and solutions.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Are Looking For<br><br></strong>We are looking for candidates that can wear two hats comfortably - “business” and “data” - with at least 2-3 years of client facing experience with Google Analytics. Ideally, this experience is with a digital marketing consulting firm, agency, or advertiser.<br><br>Beyond the experience with Google Analytics, in our eyes the most important qualities are intellectual curiosity, autonomy, and proactivity.<br><br><strong>Required Skills &amp; Experience<br><br></strong><ul><li>You have deep knowledge and experience using Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and other parts of the Google Marketing Platform. </li><li>You have a deep knowledge and understanding of the data, adtech, and martech industry.</li><li>You have experience managing strategic projects and/or clients.</li><li>You’re someone who can sit in a room/Zoom with large clients and confidently establish yourself as a business partner while providing guidance on their analytics and data strategy.</li><li>You lean into a challenge; resilient and are a practitioner of accountability.</li><li>You are a self-directed, resourceful, and a critical thinker with attention-to-detail and problem-solving skills.</li><li>You are someone who loves to collaborate within cross-functional teams.</li><li>You have self and situational awareness; an ability to ‘read the room’; a leader and a listener.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred<br><br></strong><ul><li>You have experience implementing, and utilizing the data from a variety of other digital analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics, Optimize 360, etc. </li><li>You have experience with BI/Data analysis tools (Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.).</li><li>Familiarity with cloud data (GCP / BigQuery, AWS, etc) and how to leverage it is a big plus.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li>Career growth in a disruptor space &amp; entrepreneurial opportunity within the Media.Monks network </li><li>A globally diverse &amp; inclusive culture</li><li>Remote working environment</li><li>Flexible time off + 15 paid holidays</li><li>Company contribution (3%) to 401k, regardless of employee contribution</li><li>Company paid medical, dental, and vision insurance with additional niche benefits</li><li>Base Salary Band: $80,000 - $120,000<br><br></li></ul><strong>About Media.Monks<br><br></strong>Media.Monks is on a mission to create a new future for this industry. Our vision? Build everything with a belief that changing for good comes from changing who does the work. Yep, that means you. Welcome to the party—one global, cross-cultural collective with a passion for using our skills to create better and a better world. That’s how we’re able to connect the dots between data, content, digital media, and technology from everywhere we are—a true end-to-end model. Joining the Media.Monks collective means having the opportunity to create award-winning work with some of the most gifted, focused, joyful, talents from all over the world.<br><br>At Media.Monks, you’ll be joining a highly ambitious company on a global mission to win the decade by changing the industry for good. Partner to 8 of the 10 most innovative companies in the world, Media.Monks works with established as well as up-and-coming global, regional, DTC and B2B brands, helping them own their data and build out customer ecosystems to elicit smart, efficient, high-impact engines for growth. We deliver table stakes quickly, creating cost efficiencies from day one to push up the creative effectiveness of our work with every cycle.<br><br>We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us.<br><br>

title: Google Analytics Data Specialist
description: <strong>Employee Type:<br><br></strong>Full time<br><br><strong>Location:<br><br></strong>IL Oak Brook<br><br><strong>Job Type:<br><br></strong>Supply Chain Procurement<br><br><strong>Job Posting Title:<br><br></strong>Procurement Data Analyst<br><br><strong>About Us:<br><br></strong>TreeHouse Foods (NYSE: THS) is a leading manufacturer of private label packaged foods and beverages, operating a network of production facilities across the United States and Canada. At TreeHouse Foods, our commitment to excellence extends beyond our products and revolves around our people. We are investing in talent and creating a performance-based culture where employees can do their best work, directly impacting our mission to make high quality, affordable food for our customers, communities and families. We hope you will consider joining the team and being part of our future.<br><br><strong>What You Gain:<br></strong><ul><li>Competitive compensation and benefits program</li><li>Enrollment in our wellness and employee assistance programs</li><li>Paid holidays, vacation, and other competitive paid time off opportunities</li><li>An inclusive working environment where you can build meaningful work relationships with a diverse group of people </li><li>Leaders who are invested in supporting your career growth</li><li>Opportunities to be recognized for outstanding contributions to your team through our employee recognition programs<br><br></li></ul><strong>Job Description:<br><br></strong><strong>About the Role:<br><br></strong>Treehouse is looking for a motivated and analytical Procurement Analyst to join our supplier integration team. The Procurement Analyst will be responsible for addressing supplier escalation issues raised by material planners, supply planning managers, and other internal parties within the organization. In this role, you will help solve immediate problems, perform root cause analysis, and develop sustainable resolutions. You will also focus on data analysis, master data maintenance, creating and maintaining supplier scorecards, and providing ad-hoc analysis.<br><br><strong>Qualifications &amp; Skills:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain, Business Administration, or related fields</li><li>1-3 years of procurement, supply chain, or logistics experience</li><li>Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal</li><li>Ability to work independently, self-starter, and comfortable with ambiguous tasks</li><li>Strong team player with a collaborative mindset</li><li>ERP experience (SAP preferred)</li><li>Power BI or Tableau experience preferred</li><li>Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel<br><br></li></ul><strong>Important Details:</strong> This is a full-time permanent role located out of our corporate office in Oakbrook, IL on a hybrid work schedule (3 days onsite / 2 remote). There is approximately 10% travel requirements for this role.<br><br><strong>Your TreeHouse Foods Career is Just a Click Away!<br><br></strong>Click on the “Apply” button or go directly to www.treehousefoods.com/careers to let us know you’re ready to join our team!<br><br><strong>Your TreeHouse Foods Career is Just a Click Away!<br><br></strong>Click on the “Apply” button or go directly to www.treehousefoods.com/careers to let us know you’re ready to join our team!<br><br>TreeHouse Use Only: #IND1

title: Procurement Data Analyst
description: Genesis10 is currently seeking a Data Analyst for a one year contract ending in May 2024 working a hybrid schedule with a manufacturing company in Lisle, IL.Local candidates (preferred) to the Lisle area. However, the manager is open to remote possibility but only for top tier candidates. Summary: As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in ensuring that our data foundation supports the company's systems and digital journeys. Specifically, you will contribute to initiatives such as Enterprise eCommerce, Salesforce CRM (supporting eighteen business groups with a wide variety of functionality), Digital Transformation and Master Data Management. Responsibilities: Lead data migration efforts Provide analytics for data cleanup and usage-based license requirements Identify and resolve issues with data quality and completeness in Salesforce and eCommerce applications Provide user support for embedded Salesforce Advanced Analytics/Tableau CRM tools and eCommerce BI reports Develop platform-based reports and dashboards Develop actionable metrics which enable the business to manage and improve their programs Drive Data Governance initiatives Establish and enforce data best practices across all group initiatives Qualifications: BS in Computer Science, or 5 years applicable experience with a BS in another technical field At least 5 years experience Required/Preferred Certifications: none Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills, with high attention to detail Proven ability to handle complexity Proven ability to succeed in a cross-functional environment working with business users, project team members and IT development personnel Strong understanding of system processes and methodologies to insure data quality across multiple environments and applications Excellent written and oral communication skills Experience in an Agile development environment Curious, goal oriented and highly self-motivated with a passion for driving transformative change and strong customer service orientation; enjoys people and creates raving fans Work experience in manufacturing industry or parts distribution a plus Experience with E-Commerce applications and content requirements preferred Proficient with MS Office Suite: Word, Visio, (Advanced) Excel, and PowerPoint SQL query skills (Hadoop Hive or Impala, MS SQL Server, Oracle, DB2) Prior experience with Salesforce Advanced Analytics/Tableau CRM preferred Compensation is $70-75 If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, apply today! Ranked a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S. by Staffing Industry Analysts for six consecutive years, Genesis10 puts thousands of consultants and employees to work across the United States every yearin contract, contract-for-hire, and permanent placement roles. With more than 300 active clients, Genesis10 provides access to many of the Fortune 100 firms and a variety of mid-market organizations across the full spectrum of industry verticals. Benefits of Working with Genesis10: Access to hundreds of clients, most who have been working with Genesis10 for 5-20+ years. The opportunity to have a career-home in Genesis10; many of our consultants have been working exclusively with Genesis10 for years. Access to an experienced, caring recruiting team (more than 7 years of experience, on average.) Medical, Dental, Vision Health Savings Account Voluntary Hospital Indemnity (Critical Illness &amp; Accident) Voluntary Term Life Insurance 401K Sick Pay (for applicable states/municipalities) Commuter Benefits (Dallas, NYC, SF) Remote opportunities available For multiple years running, Genesis10 has been recognized as a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S., as a Best Company for Work-Life Balance, as a Best Company for Career Growth, for Diversity, and for Leadership, amongst others. To learn more and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at our website. Genesis10 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Data Analyst
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>In this role, you will join a fast-paced Human Resources analytics team as an HR Reporting &amp; Data Integration Analyst and serve as the Workday HCM data and reporting subject matter expert. This experienced candidate will have strong expertise in developing and maintaining simple to complex reports and dashboards specifically but not limited to matrix, composite, scorecards, and analytical indicators utilizing Workday’s report writer as well as other tools and available technologies. You will be an expert in building and maintaining complex calculated fields and have a solid understanding of the relationships within Workday’s Business Objects. In addition, this role will also support other areas of HR reporting including Tableau developed reports and dashboards from a data quality perspective, as well as data migration and transformation into our cloud environment. This role will be a liaison to Business Technology to support new and existing data from Workday to our data warehouse for continued use in advanced reporting and analytics development. As a Lead Reporting &amp; Analytics Developer, you will also be responsible for understanding and supporting data stewardship initiatives and the importance of security for all HR data the team manages. A successful team member will be extremely detail orientated, flexible with continuous process / system changes and comprehend the abilities and limitations from a reporting perspective.<p><br></p>Responsible for creating reporting solutions and partnering with technology teams to manage Human Resources data and reporting technologies. Designs and develops analyses on the employee population, including demographic profiles, turnover ratios, activity reports, and recruitment data. Partners with internal clients to address reporting needs. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Creates report solutions</li><li>Consults with internal clients on the development of analytics including: needs assessments, programming, and delivery of report solutions.</li><li>Identifies, troubleshoots, and validates data discrepancies between data sources. Provides solutions to improve accuracy and usability of data.</li><li>Develops self service tools that enable users to interact with data sets, process data, and generate reports.</li><li>Utilizes tools and automation to satisfy key compliance data requirements.</li><li>Manages HR data warehouse architecture in partnership with technology team.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Analytics, Statistics or related field </li><li>2+ years of experience in Reporting, analytics, relational and multi-dimensional databases, report writing software, internal client requirements, developing data-driven solutions, report building, HRIS systems or related</li><li>In lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in HR Analytics and reporting </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>If we had our say, we’d also look for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Prior HR experience in a data/analytics/reporting role</li><li>Previous Snowflake or similar data warehouse experience </li><li>Workday Report Writer experience</li><li>An understanding of data stewardship and security for all HR data the team manages</li><li>Strong expertise in developing and maintaining simple to complex reports and dashboards specifically but not limited to matrix, composite, scorecards, and analytical indicators utilizing Workday’s report writer as well as other tools and available technologies</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $74,000.00 to $124,800.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: HR Reporting & Data Integration Analyst
description: NO SPONSORSHIP<p><br></p><strong>Data Quality Test Engineer</strong><p><br></p>LOCATION: CHICAGO, IL OR Remote<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will be local and possibly open to contract-to-hire down the road.<p><br></p><strong>Second choice is fully remote</strong><p><br></p>Duration: Minimum one year<p><br></p>SELLING POINTS: Must be solid in SQL Database implementation new features improvement of existing functionality for data architecture projects. Integration testing, customer data quality, testing data verification, regression testing.<p><br></p>The Test Engineer will be responsible for ensuring the successful implementation of new features as well as improvement of existing functionality for data architecture projects. This includes Integration testing, Customer Data Quality testing, Data verification testing, Regression testing etc.<p><br></p>This is a hands-on testing position which requires deep knowledge and understanding of all aspects of developing and executing Back-end testing. The Test Engineer must be an advocate for all things Testing and Quality Assurance while driving and implementing best practices. The ideal candidate must possess strong analytical and critical thinking abilities. Data testing skills are required.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree</li><li>Hands-on experience using SQL queries for results validation and data mining.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Planning and Manual test execution.</li><li>Experience in Regression Test Strategies, Regression suite maintenance and execution.</li><li>At least 3-5 years of professional experience on a variety of projects in Test Strategy, Test Design, Test Execution analysis &amp; reporting.</li><li>Hands-on experience with Jira, ALM, TFS/ADO or similar systems of record.</li><li>Understanding of Development and Test cycles, including respective best practices.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Agile and Waterfall methodologies.</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot issues, identifying root causes and support development team in development of resolutions.</li><li>Strong communication and Client/Business interfacing and interpersonal skills are a must.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Request Technology</u></strong><p><br></p>Request Technology, LLC consists of a group of Associate Recruiters, each of whom has an extensive background within the search industry. We fill positions at every level, from entry level to executive. Our specialties have proven to be our strength within the industry; we have successfully filled more than 80 percent of our available positions. With each engagement, we gain a better understanding of an organizations corporate culture and the needs of IT positions within it. Further more, we partner with our clients to match the candidate’s personality with the company culture by learning about the candidate’s background, which companies they have worked for, why they have left organizations and what motivates them to succeed. Thank you for your interest in Request Technology. For additional information, please visit our Web site at www.requesttechnology.com or call me at 630-717-5865. Because we work on a contingency basis, you have no obligation to us until we find you the right candidate. We back this up by offering you a three-month, money-back guarantee. I look forward to working with you and demonstrating for you firsthand why Request Technology is peerless in a highly competitive industry.

title: SQL Database Quality Test Engineer
description: <p>Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Cardinal Health, Inc. (NYSE: CAH) is a global, integrated healthcare services and products company connecting patients, providers, payers, pharmacists and manufacturers for integrated care coordination and better patient management. Backed by nearly 100 years of experience, with more than 40,000 employees in nearly 60 countries, Cardinal Health ranks among the top 20 on the Fortune 500.</p><p></p><p>We boast tremendous opportunities to grow and apply technical skills to meet organizational needs, empowering talented team members who mentor and uplift others, led by leaders with a focus on employee development and well-being, dedicated training programs, and a collaborative atmosphere.  </p><p></p><p>We currently have a career opening for an IT Business Analyst.  We are open to a remote worker in the role.</p><p></p><p><strong><span>Responsibilities</span></strong></p><p>The Enterprise Solution Delivery team is searching for an IT Business Analyst to join our team. The person fulfilling this position will have the opportunity to work with many different applications within Cardinal Health. They will be the go-to person for working with our team's stakeholders to understand, document, and help execute solutions that meet their needs while remaining in compliance with Cardinal Health policies and procedures. This role will work with many different functional areas of IT and apply that experience along with customer relationship management skills to provide our partners with best-in-class solutions and support that exceed their expectations.</p><p></p><p><strong><span>What Business Analysis contributes to Cardinal Health</span></strong></p><ul><li><p>Information Technology oversees the effective development, delivery, and operation of computing and information services. This function anticipates, plans, and delivers Information Technology solutions and strategies that enable operations and drive business value.</p></li><li><p>Business Analysis serves as a liaison between the organization's businesses and IT systems <span>development</span> teams to align business strategies and capability needs and to ensure IT systems enable their desired value. This job family identifies and analyzes business needs, defines requirements and objectives, makes recommendations for solutions using new and existing technologies, and assists with the implementation process.</p></li><li><p>This job family researches and documents relationships between the components of the application system (i.e., end users, business processes, data, applications, and devices) and translates business requirements into application requirements that are implemented into production systems.</p></li></ul><p></p><p><strong><span>Qualifications</span></strong></p><p></p><p><em><span>Required </span></em></p><ul><li><p><span>Proven experience as a hands-on IT Business Analyst</span></p></li><li><p>Prior experience working with IT project stakeholders obtaining end user requirements and building internal customer relationships.  </p></li><li><p>Experience with reporting dashboarding and project timeline management.</p></li></ul><p></p><p><em><span>Preferred</span></em></p><ul><li><p>Applies comprehensive knowledge and a thorough understanding of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to perform varied tasks and projects</p></li><li><p>Experience developing policies and procedures.</p></li><li><p>Experience on IT centric complex projects of large scope</p></li></ul><p><em>Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.</em></p><br><br><p><em>Cardinal Health supports an inclusive workplace that values diversity of thought, experience and background. We celebrate the power of our differences to create better solutions for our customers by ensuring employees can be their authentic selves each day. Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, pregnancy, veteran status, marital status, creed, status with regard to public assistance, genetic status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.</em></p>
industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage, and Hospitals and Health Care

description: *We are unable to sponsor for this role*<p><br></p>*All Employees must be Covid-19 Vaccinated.*<p><br></p>*At the minimum year-long contract*<p><br></p>A prestigious company is on the search for a Data Quality Test Engineer. The Test Engineer will be responsible for ensuring the successful implementation of new features as well as improvement of existing functionality for data architecture projects. This includes Integration testing, Customer Data Quality testing, Data verification testing, Regression testing etc.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Review business requirements, functional specifications, use cases, design, and architecture documents to create effective, value-add test plans.</li><li>Identify and close gaps, by assisting in QA discovery or analysis of a built or process, in order to facilitate requirements refinements.</li><li>Identify issues in data, application configurations and screen designs, report and oversee issue resolution.</li><li>Plan and execute Manual, Functional, and Regression test suite.</li><li>Independently develop, modify, and execute test plans based on requirements and design documents.</li><li>Identify, report and track defects and User Experience issues through a system of record.</li><li>Collaborate with external teams on root cause analysis.</li><li>Ensuring proper traceability from requirements to test artifacts.</li><li>Actively participate in requirements and code reviews.</li><li>Actively participate and drive improvements in Agile Scrum delivery.</li><li>Be a thought leader in the test design and execution arena (manual and automated).</li><li>Creation and input of test data, either manually or by using tools, programs, or masked production data to execute test cases.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related area.</li><li>Hands-on experience using SQL queries for results validation and data mining.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Planning and Manual test execution.</li><li>Experience in Regression Test Strategies, Regression suite maintenance and execution.</li><li>At least 3-5 years of professional experience on a variety of projects in Test Strategy, Test Design, Test Execution analysis &amp; reporting.</li><li>Hands-on experience with Jira, ALM, TFS/ADO or similar systems of record.</li><li>Understanding of Development and Test cycles, including respective best practices.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Agile and Waterfall methodologies.</li></ul>

title: Data Quality Test Engineer
description: <strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong> Adaptive Developer<p><br></p><strong>Department:</strong> Finance<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Remote/Hybrid<p><br></p>Acrisure is a fast-growing fintech leader that operates a global insurance broker. The Company has grown from $38 million to $4.0 billion in revenue since 2013 and deploys the best of Human and Artificial Intelligence (AI) at scale to reimagine financial service product distribution. Acrisure employs over 14,000 employees across thirteen countries. <p><br></p>Led by co-founder, Chairman and CEO Greg Williams, Acrisure provides a broad array of insurance and financial related solutions, including commercial property and casualty, personal lines and employee benefits insurance, real estate services, cyber services and asset and wealth management. Acrisure’s massively valuable, high margin distribution network combines the strength of trusted advisors with growth and efficiency enabled by AI.<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>Primarily responsible for providing consultation and implementation of Workday Adaptive Planning to our various business units. Be a subject matter expert in FP&amp;A practice and the use of planning modules to support organization planning calculation and modeling. The role identifies and implements long-range goals to increase accuracy, gain workload capacity, and create insight while becoming a more technology-enabled company.<p><br></p><strong>Essential Duties:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analyzing financial models and reports (spreadsheet/non-spreadsheet-based models) and translating those models into Adaptive Planning</li><li>Provide technical guidance (design, model, configuration, troubleshooting, etc.) for the Adaptive suite of products.</li><li>Manage data integrations into Adaptive from other source systems to include troubleshooting intermittent data and or break/fix issues</li><li>Work closely with the Director of Finance and team to ensure not only timely and accurate financial reporting, but also provide technical guidance to users to ensure optimization of the system</li><li>Serve as the primary point of contact for Adaptive who will create and revise configurations and customizations to meet evolving business and operational needs</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work with stakeholders to understand their business and take a consultative approach to designing planning models in Adaptive Planning</li><li>Configure and demonstrate planning prototypes</li><li>Actively participate in update training and internal opportunities to share one’s skills and learnings with others within the organization</li><li>Maintain cutting-edge knowledge of product functionality with each new Workday release</li><li>Demonstrate strong client and stakeholder management to achieve project objectives</li><li>Support innovation through the creation of new industry-leading methods and approach</li><li>Educate team members of diverse technical backgrounds Acrisure Adaptive Planning models &amp; reporting</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Implementing budgets, forecasts, and reports within Adaptive Planning for Finance</li><li>Analyzing financial models and reports (spreadsheet/non-spreadsheet-based models) and translating those models into Adaptive Planning</li><li>Provide technical guidance (design, model, configuration, troubleshooting, etc.) for the Adaptive suite of products</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication, responsiveness, and active listening skills. Successfully translates technical terminology to language that is easily understood and applicable to business priorities. </li><li>Ability to speak to both the financial and technical aspects of EPM</li><li>Experience managing technical upgrades and ETL/data movement is a plus</li><li>Ability to effectively define key objectives, set clear goals, consistently measure and monitor progress &amp; performance, and produce successful results. </li><li>Providing business analysis and requirements gathering.</li><li>Demonstrating project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while being detail-oriented</li><li>Having exposure to business process mapping and/or re-engineering is preferred.</li><li>Thrive in a diverse, fast-paced environment</li><li>Ability to use data to identify insights that drive action. </li><li>Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Adaptable. </li><li>Ability to identify business needs, take the initiative to ask questions, and manage expectations unbiasedly. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education/Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2 years+ of experience working with Adaptive Planning</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or Computer Science, experience in FP&amp;A role a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desired:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Understanding of Insurance brokerage operations.</li><li>3 years + experience implementing FP&amp;A planning or reporting modules</li><li>Project management certifications and/or focus on Agile concepts. </li><li>Strong Data Management skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Acrisure is committed to employing a diverse workforce. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status. <strong>California</strong> residents can learn more about our privacy practices for applicants by visiting the Acrisure California Applicant Privacy Policy available at www.Acrisure.com/privacy/caapplicant.<p><br></p>Acrisure is equally committed to supporting social issues. In 2021, the Company co-founded Evolution Advisors, a joint venture focused on providing greater access and more effectively distributing insurance products and financial services to minority-owned enterprises. In its home of Grand Rapids, Acrisure provided $15 million to create the Acrisure Center for Innovation in Children’s Health at Helen DeVos Children’s Hospital.<p><br></p>To Executive Search Firms &amp; Staffing Agencies: Acrisure does not accept unsolicited resumes from any agencies that have not signed a mutual service agreement. All unsolicited resumes will be considered Acrisure’s property, and Acrisure will not be obligated to pay a referral fee. This includes resumes submitted directly to Hiring Managers without contacting Acrisure’s Human Resources Talent Department.<p><br></p>

title: Adaptive Developer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Devops infrastructure experience</li><li>OpenShift/Kubernetes</li><li>Strong Linux administration/scripting skillsets</li><li>CI/CD with Jenkins or similar</li><li>Git/GitHub</li><li>AWS</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to solve problems and articulate solutions to leadership.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Strong collaboration skills, responsive to service needs and project demands in a fast-changing environment.</li><li>Golang programing language</li><li>AWS RDS experience (Postgres)</li><li>Redis administration experience </li><li>Working in agile environment</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: MS Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As an Adobe Implementation Specialist, you will be part of DNA Marketing Technology team, serving teams that engage with customers and prospects throughout the customer journey, from acquisition marketing to portfolio collections to digital app experience across Discover. You will work with DNA Martech Engineers, Data collections product owners, Business stakeholders and Data Scientists to design, develop and implement technical tagging requirements for company web and mobile app platforms.<p><br></p>You will lead the design and implementation of MarTech solutions with a focus on Adobe Analytics, Adobe Launch and AEP. You will be a liaison between the Adobe Analytics analysts, launch implementation developers, and data layer developers, owning projects to ensure tagging is complete and accurate. You will have the opportunity to work on solutions that drive business value for improved analysis, storytelling, and customer journey development.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develops and leads an Agile team focused on next-generation data and analytic technologies.</li><li>Provides technical consulting in support of the creation and enhancement of analytical platforms and tools.</li><li>Provides technical consulting to application development teams during application design and development for highly complex and critical data projects.</li><li>Partners on a team to deliver data projects, including migration to new data technologies for unstructured, streaming, and high-volume data.</li><li>Develops and deploys big data applications.</li><li>Builds and administers large scale data platforms. Integrates next-generation data analytic tools into the big data ecosystem.</li><li>Responsible for architecting, configuring, and administering an analytics infrastructure in partnership with Product, Design, and IT Development.</li><li>Debugs/troubleshoots/resolves Adobe configuration and integration issues.</li><li>Assess, audit and identify gaps in existing tagging, infrastructure and Adobe Launch configurations.</li><li>Develops and document Discover MarTech’s data collection standards and best practices.</li><li>Support implementation architecture strategy and governance</li><li>Develops instrumentation strategies across multiple websites &amp; mobile apps.</li><li>Provides guidance and mentorship to the development team to ensure high-quality code and adherence to coding standards.<br><br></li></ul><ul><li>Responsible for the following tasks:</li><ul><li>Tagging for both websites &amp; native mobile apps in enterprise-grade environments</li><li>Tagging schemas and specifications for new sites and new site features</li><li>Quality Assurance and debugging of tagging as implemented by engineers.</li><li>Data layer design and implementation</li><li>Writing tagging specifications for engineers.<br><br></li></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related field</li><li>2+ years of experience in Data Platform Administration, Engineering, or related field</li><li>In lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in Data Platform Administration, Engineering, or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>If we had our say, we’d also look for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years’ Experience in Data Platform Administration, Engineering, or related field, with 4+ years on Adobe Analytics</li><li>Strong knowledge of tag management data collection platforms such as Adobe Launch, GTM etc.</li><li>The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in the Adobe ecosystem, including Adobe Experience platform, Adobe Launch, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics and Adobe Mobile SDK.</li><li>Must have hands-on experience in creating Analytics solutions design, implementation, and integrations.</li><li>Expert in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, XML</li><li>Strong knowledge of JavaScript and common libraries used in website building (e. g. jQquery, React).</li><li>Knowledge of considerations of analytics code and 3rd description_json: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As an Adobe Implementation Specialist, you will be part of DNA Marketing Technology team, serving teams that engage with customers and prospects throughout the customer journey, from acquisition marketing to portfolio collections to digital app experience across Discover. You will work with DNA Martech Engineers, Data collections product owners, Business stakeholders and Data Scientists to design, develop and implement technical tagging requirements for company web and mobile app platforms.<p><br></p>You will lead the design and implementation of MarTech solutions with a focus on Adobe Analytics, Adobe Launch and AEP. You will be a liaison between the Adobe Analytics analysts, launch implementation developers, and data layer developers, owning projects to ensure tagging is complete and accurate. You will have the opportunity to work on solutions that drive business value for improved analysis, storytelling, and customer journey development.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develops and leads an Agile team focused on next-generation data and analytic technologies.</li><li>Provides technical consulting in support of the creation and enhancement of analytical platforms and tools.</li><li>Provides technical consulting to application development teams during application design and development for highly complex and critical data projects.</li><li>Partners on a team to deliver data projects, including migration to new data technologies for unstructured, streaming, and high-volume data.</li><li>Develops and deploys big data applications.</li><li>Builds and administers large scale data platforms. Integrates next-generation data analytic tools into the big data ecosystem.</li><li>Responsible for architecting, configuring, and administering an analytics infrastructure in partnership with Product, Design, and IT Development.</li><li>Debugs/troubleshoots/resolves Adobe configuration and integration issues.</li><li>Assess, audit and identify gaps in existing tagging, infrastructure and Adobe Launch configurations.</li><li>Develops and document Discover MarTech’s data collection standards and best practices.</li><li>Support implementation architecture strategy and governance</li><li>Develops instrumentation strategies across multiple websites &amp; mobile apps.</li><li>Provides guidance and mentorship to the development team to ensure high-quality code and adherence to coding standards.<br><br></li></ul><ul><li>Responsible for the following tasks:</li><ul><li>Tagging for both websites &amp; native mobile apps in enterprise-grade environments</li><li>Tagging schemas and specifications for new sites and new site features</li><li>Quality Assurance and debugging of tagging as implemented by engineers.</li><li>Data layer design and implementation</li><li>Writing tagging specifications for engineers.<br><br></li></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related field</li><li>2+ years of experience in Data Platform Administration, Engineering, or related field</li><li>In lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in Data Platform Administration, Engineering, or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>If we had our say, we’d also look for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years’ Experience in Data Platform Administration, Engineering, or related field, with 4+ years on Adobe Analytics</li><li>Strong knowledge of tag management data collection platforms such as Adobe Launch, GTM etc.</li><li>The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in the Adobe ecosystem, including Adobe Experience platform, Adobe Launch, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics and Adobe Mobile SDK.</li><li>Must have hands-on experience in creating Analytics solutions design, implementation, and integrations.</li><li>Expert in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, XML</li><li>Strong knowledge of JavaScript and common libraries used in website building (e. g. jQquery, React).</li><li>Knowledge of considerations of analytics code and 3rd parties SDKs implementation in native mobile apps.</li><li>Be able to create SDR and convert it to exact script code to be added on page/app screens or user actions on page.</li><li>Experience with Real Time CDP Connections integration with AdTech products.</li><li>Knowledge of single page applications web analytics data collection integrations</li><li>Have solid analytics implementation experience across the life cycle and digital platforms (including web, responsive and native mobile apps) using Adobe/Google Analytics especially for complex eco-systems (multiple sites/apps, 100s of custom tags, multiple implementation techniques for main site/syndicate sites etc.)</li><li>Adobe Analytics Architect Master certificate.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $74,000.00 to $124,800.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for?
