title: Adobe Implementation Specialist
description: Sumitomo Electric Carbide, Inc. a world leader in the production and distribution of tools for metal cutting industries currently has an opening for a <strong>Service Engineer</strong> in <strong>Chicago, IL</strong>.<p><br></p><strong>Company Overview</strong><p><br></p>One of the largest carbide manufacturers in the world, Sumitomo has been operating in the United States since 1979 with multiple US based tooling manufacturing facilities. A technology first mentality has driven Sumitomo to be a leader in product development, quality and customer satisfaction. The Sumitomo Electric Group employs over 250,000 people globally throughout 40 countries, more than 3,500 of which are part of the Hard Metals division. Sumitomo develops, manufactures and brings to market the finest cutting tools in the industry. We strive for excellence, so we require the best. A rapidly growing company with ever expanding opportunities for employee growth has made Sumitomo a great career choice. To learn more about Sumitomo Electric Carbide, Inc., please visit www.sumicarbide.com.<p><br></p>The position is responsible for a broad range of <strong>Service Engineer</strong> activities such as:<p><br></p><strong>Job Duties And Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><strong>Confirms Tooling Specifications</strong><p><br></p>by consulting with customer, Sales Engineer and/or Supervisor to plan tooling requirements; by providing tooling recommendations; by studying blueprints, sketches, machine parts or specifications to determine installation procedures; and by observing and listening to operating machines or equipment to diagnose tool malfunction and recommend adjustments as necessary.<p><br></p><strong>Communicates with Customers</strong><p><br></p>by communicating regularly with customers; by responding to questions in a timely manner; and by providing customers with test data, observations, and corrective measures necessary to improve tool performance.<p><br></p><strong>Performs Administrative Duties</strong><p><br></p>by submitting monthly reports, test reports, trip reports, call schedules, and call reports; by managing the sample account, trunk stock account, and expense account; and by performing any other duties as directed by Management.<p><br></p><strong>Skills/Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Associate’s degree from a two-year college, vocational or technical school and two to four years of experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience/training</li><li> Experience working in a CNC environment</li><li> Exceptional competency in CNC machining</li><li> Must have experience in the cutting tools industry or similar industry</li><li> Must be able to use a computer and applications such as Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel</li><li> Effective management of time and resources, strong organizational skills, effective communication and compliance with established policies and procedures</li></ul><p><br></p>Sumitomo offers excellent benefits and competitive salary for the right candidate! If qualified, please send your resume and cover letter explaining your strengths and accomplishments.<p><br></p><strong>About Sumitomo Electric Carbide, Inc.</strong><p><br></p>One of the largest carbide manufacturers in the world, SCI has been operating in the United States since 1979 with multiple US based tooling manufacturing facilities. A technology first mentality has driven SCI to be a leader in product development, quality and customer satisfaction. The Sumitomo Electric Group employs over 250,000 people globally throughout 40 countries, more than 3,500 of which are part of the Hard Metals division. Sumitomo develops, manufactures and brings to market the finest cutting tools in the industry. We strive for excellence, so we require the best. A rapidly growing company with ever expanding opportunities for employee growth has made Sumitomo a great career choice. To learn more about Sumitomo Electric Carbide, Inc., please visit www.sumicarbide.com.<p><br></p><strong>About Sumitomo Electric Group</strong><p><br></p>Since the founding of Sumitomo Electric Industries, Ltd. in 1897 with copper wire production, we have developed many new technologies and product through innovative R&amp;D activities based on Sumitomo Electric manufacturing technologies for electric wires and power cables. With more than 320 subsidiaries worldwide, we continue to introduce a wide variety of products that fulfill the expectations of society, in five business fields: Automotive, Information &amp; Communications, Electronics, Environment &amp; Energy, and Industrial Materials.<p><br></p>To learn more about Sumitomo Electric Group, please visit www.sumitomo.com.

title: OIPA Developer
description: <p>There are over 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we're all about at John Deere. And it's why we're investing in our people and our technology like never before! Here the world's brightest minds are tackling the world's biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we'll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.</p><p> </p><p><em>John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.</em></p><p><em> </em></p><p><strong><em>Primary Location:</em></strong><em> United States (US) - Illinois - East Moline </em></p><p><strong><em>Function:</em></strong><em> Engineering (CA)</em></p><p><strong><em>Title: </em></strong><em>Development Engineer - 96236</em> </p><p><strong><em>Onsite/Remote:</em></strong><em>Onsite Position</em></p><p><br></p><p><em> </em></p><p><strong>Your Responsibilities</strong></p><p><br></p><p> </p><p>As a <strong>Development Engineer</strong> for the John Deere Harvester Works division located in East Moline at Silvis, IL, you will:</p><p> </p><ul><li>Performs basic product design, testing and/or analysis work for a defined portion of a project.</li><li>Operates in a team environment, providing input to design solutions and participating in design reviews.</li><li>Develops recommendations within established guidelines; work and decisions are reviewed by supervisors before implementation.</li><li>Executes test or analysis plan for product verification and validation.</li><li>Supports field testing sites.</li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>VISA Sponsorship is NOT Available for this position.</strong></p><p><strong>What Skills You Need</strong></p><p><br></p><p> </p><ul><li>1 or more years of experience in product engineering, design and/or test.</li><li>Experience with 3D modeling.</li><li>Strong organizational and communication skills.</li><li>Experience in roles that demonstrate an understanding of creating efficient solutions to technical problems.</li><li>Must have an Engineering degree</li></ul><p><strong>What Makes You Stand Out</strong></p><p><br></p><p> </p><ul><li>Experience with agricultural or heavy equipment, vehicle, component, or software testing.</li><li>Technical knowledge of diesel engine systems.</li><li>Experience using data collection and/or data processing software.</li><li>Experience with mechanical and/or electrical systems.</li></ul><p><strong>Education Details</strong></p><p><br></p><p> </p><p>Ideally you will have a degree or equivalent related work experience in the following:</p><p> </p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in engineering.</li></ul><p><strong>What You'll Get</strong></p><p>At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go while working in an inclusive team environment. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. Additionally, we offer a comprehensive reward package to help you get started on your new career path, including:</p><ul><li>Flexible work arrangements</li><li>Highly competitive base pay and performance bonuses</li><li>Savings &amp; Retirement benefits (401K and Defined Benefit Pension)</li><li>Healthcare benefits with a generous company contribution in the Health Savings Account</li><li>Adoption assistance</li><li>Employee Assistance Programs</li><li>Tuition assistance</li><li>Fitness subsidies and on-site gyms at specific Deere locations</li><li>Charitable contribution match</li><li>Employee Purchase Plan &amp; numerous discount programs for personal use</li></ul><p> </p><p>Follow this link to learn more about our Total Rewards Package https://bit.ly/3XCd8fL </p><p> </p><p>The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.</p><p> </p><p>The terms of the applicable benefit plans, and all company actions administering or interpreting these plans, continue to control. Deere &amp; Company reserves the right to suspend, amend, modify, or terminate the Plan(s) in any manner at any time, including the right to modify or eliminate any cost-sharing between the company and participants. Changes, which can be made at any time, are made by action of the company's board of directors, or to the extent authorized by resolution of its board of directors, or by the Deere &amp; Company Compensation Committee. In the event of a conflict between the language of the official Plan Documents and this document, the language of the official Plan Documents will control.</p><p> </p><p> </p><p>ACA Section 1557 Nondiscrimination Notice</p><p>The John Deere Health Benefit Plans for Salaried Employees and The John Deere Benefit Plan for Wage Employees comply with applicable Federal civil rights laws and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, disability, or sex.</p><p> </p><p>APPLY TO THIS JOB</p><p></p>

title: Service Engineer
description: Skills: 5+ years of experience in Salesforce development. Experience in Apex, Visualforce, and Salesforce Lightning is a plus. Experience with integration using REST and SOAP APIs. Experience with Salesforce Community Cloud, Sales Cloud, and Service Cloud is preferred. Experience with Agile development methodologies. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field. Excellent communication and teamwork skills. Responsibilities: Design and develop solutions within the Salesforce platform, including customizations, integrations, and enhancements to existing functionality, with a focus on delivering solutions for our business operations. Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements. Develop and maintain custom Visualforce pages, Apex classes, and triggers. Develop and maintain integrations between Salesforce and other systems, using REST and SOAP APIs. Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to support business processes. Participate in code reviews and ensure that all solutions are aligned with coding standards and best practices. Identify opportunities for process improvements and work with stakeholders to implement them. Salesforce Developer
description_json: Skills: 5+ years of experience in Salesforce development. Experience in Apex, Visualforce, and Salesforce Lightning is a plus. Experience with integration using REST and SOAP APIs. Experience with Salesforce Community Cloud, Sales Cloud, and Service Cloud is preferred. Experience with Agile development methodologies. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field. Excellent communication and teamwork skills. Responsibilities: Design and develop solutions within the Salesforce platform, including customizations, integrations, and enhancements to existing functionality, with a focus on delivering solutions for our business operations. Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements. Develop and maintain custom Visualforce pages, Apex classes, and triggers. Develop and maintain integrations between Salesforce and other systems, using REST and SOAP APIs. Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to support business processes. Participate in code reviews and ensure that all solutions are aligned with coding standards and best practices. Identify opportunities for process improvements and work with stakeholders to implement them. Salesforce Developer

title: Development Engineer
description: <strong>Looking for the next step in your career? Enjoy a challenge? Do you have an ambition for innovation? Want to make a difference? <br><br></strong>If you join our growing global team, you’ll be working for an industry leader with offices across five continents, in over 47 countries and more than 28 000 employees. You will work with some of the leading world brands across the Fortune 100 and Fortune 500 companies – who are all relying on Dimension Data to help them use the power of technology to achieve their ambition in this digital era.You’ll be part of a team who’s passionate about making a difference to the way technology shapes how we live and work – whether it’s protecting the rhino, connecting the G20 Summit, or revolutionising cycling, giving you the opportunity to do great things.<br><br>You’ll be joining a Global Top Employer, recognised for investing in talent because people are at the heart of our success. You provide the skills, passion and ideas, and we’ll provide the platform to realise your ambitions.Great talent. Great teams. Great work. Great opportunities.<br><br><strong>Want to be part of our team?<br><br></strong>Provides technical support to field engineers, technicians, and product support personnel who are diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing, and debugging complex electro/mechanical equipment, computer systems, complex software, or networked and/or wireless systems.<br><br>Responds to situations where first-line product support has failed to isolate or fix problems in malfunctioning equipment or software. Reports design, reliability, and maintenance problems or bugs to design engineering/software engineering. May be involved in customer installation and training.<br><br>Provides support to customers/users where the product is highly technical or sophisticated in nature.<br><br><strong>What You'll Be Doing<br><br></strong>The MS Engineer is responsible for providing a service to clients by proactively identifying and resolving technical incidents and problems. Through preemptive service incident and resolution activities, as well as product reviews, operational improvements, operational practices, and quality assurance this role will maintain a high level of service to clients. Their primary objective is to ensure zero missed service level agreement (SLA) conditions .The MS Engineer s responsible for managing tickets of low to high complexity.<br><br><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Ensure that assigned infrastructure at the client site is configured, installed, tested, and operational</li><li>Perform necessary checks, apply monitoring tools and respond to alerts</li><li>Identify problems and errors prior to or when it occurs and log all such incidents in a timely manner with the required level of detail</li><li>Assist in analyzing, assigning, and escalating support calls</li><li>Investigate third line support calls assigned and identify the root cause of incidents and problems</li><li>Report and escalate issues to 3rd party vendors if necessary</li><li>Provide onsite technical support to clients and provide field engineering services to clients</li><li>Conduct a monthly random review of incidents and service requests, analyze and recommend improvement in quality</li><li>Provide continuous feedback to clients and affected parties and update all systems and/or portals as prescribed by NTT</li><li>Proactively identify opportunities for work optimization including opportunities for automation of work<br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes:<br></strong><ul><li>Ability to communicate and work across different cultures and social groups</li><li>Ability to plan activities and projects well in advance, and takes into account possible changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to maintain a positive outlook at work</li><li>Ability to work well in a pressurized environment</li><li>Ability to work hard and put in longer hours when it is necessary</li><li>Ability to apply active listening techniques such as paraphrasing the message to confirm understanding, probing for further relevant information, and refraining from interrupting</li><li>Ability to adapt to changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to place clients at the forefront of all interactions, understanding their requirements, and creating a positive client experience throughout the total client journey<br><br></li></ul><strong>Academic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Advanced diploma, degree, or relevant qualification in IT/Computing (or demonstrated equivalent work experience)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Required Experience:<br></strong><ul><li>Demonstrated work experience</li><li>Demonstrated experience required in Engineering function within a medium to large ICT organization</li><li>Demonstrated experience of Managed Services</li><li>Demonstrated working knowledge of ITIL processes</li><li>Demonstrated experience working with vendors and/or 3rd parties<br><br></li></ul><strong>What would make you a good fit for this role?<br><br></strong>Knowledge on SIEM, Crowdstrike, DLP and cyber security<br><br><strong>Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.<br><br></strong><strong>Equal opportunity employer <br><br></strong>We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, colour, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category.

title: Test Engineer
description: Wabtec Corporation is a leading global provider of equipment, systems, digital solutions and value-added services for freight and transit rail. Drawing on nearly four centuries of collective experience across Wabtec, GE Transportation and Faiveley Transport, the company has unmatched digital expertise, technological innovation, and world-class manufacturing and services, enabling the digital-rail-and-transit ecosystems. Wabtec is focused on performance that drives progress, creating transportation solutions that move and improve the world. Wabtec has approximately 27,000 employees in facilities throughout the world. Visit the company’s new website at: http://www.WabtecCorp.com.<p><br></p>It’s not just about your career… or your job title…it’s about who you are and the impact you are going to make on the world. Do you want to go into uncharted waters…do things that haven’t been done to make yours and someone else's life better? Wabtec has been doing that for decades and we will continue to do so! Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, Wabtec delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry.<p><br></p>We are the doers. The leaders. The makers. Our teams are hungry to make history, acting with integrity to relentlessly improve people’s lives. It’s time to stop dreaming about the future; let’s build it together.<p><br></p>If you are interested in joining our Talent Community, please share your resume with us. When a position that matches your qualifications becomes available it’s that much easier to connect!<p><br></p>As a System Engineer, you will use all your abilities to coordinate the design, development, and deliverables of the innovative solutions we bring to the industry in great partnership with our customers. You’ll work alongside other self-starters interested in solving complex problems for our clients, delivering high-quality solutions, driving the future of Transportation and Logistics.<p><br></p>RESPONSIBILITIES:<p><br></p><ul><li>Act as the translator of customer needs and requirements, making them crystal clear to the internal teams</li><li>Be the orchestrator of a multi-function team to design, develop, test, and deliver a high-quality solution</li><li>Lead the engineering team to design, develop, test, and deliver beyond our commitments</li><li>Be a Technical Leader for the projects across global cross-functional teams (Product / Program Management, SW COE, Electrical Integration, Train Control, Office Systems, Safety, Validation and Applications Engineering) assuring “cradle to grave” success.</li><li>Be obsessed with the state-of-the-art processes, constantly improving how we work</li><li>Be smart on money decisions, managing budgets, spending, looking for cost improvement opportunities</li><li>Act as the PR of the project, kicking it off, communicating its status to the Sr Leaders and customers</li><li>As a forever learner, promote a learning environment. With postmortem analysis, fail studies, lessons learned, etc. Using them to improve next projects</li><li>Drive the knowledge management across the team, with updated documentation</li><li>Be an inspirational leader to the team, developing, coaching, and guiding the growth of other team members<br></li></ul><p><br></p>QUALIFICATIONS:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s / Master’s Degree in ECE / EEE /Computer Science / IT or in STEM Majors or equivalent </li><li>Domain expertise</li><li>3 - 6 years of work experience working as System Engineer/Product Owner/Product development</li><li>Knowledge of AAR and CENELEC Safety standards for the rail industry.<br></li></ul><p><br></p>Wabtec Corporation is committed to taking on the world’s toughest challenges. In order to fulfill that commitment we rely on a culture of leadership, diversity and inclusiveness. We aim to employ the world’s brightest minds to help us create a limitless source of ideas and opportunities. We believe in hiring talented people of varied backgrounds, experiences and styles…people like you! Wabtec Corporation is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or protected Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

title: Quantitative C# Risk Management Developer
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Metra is one of the largest and most complex commuter rail systems in North America, serving Cook, DuPage, Will, Lake, Kane, and McHenry Counties. The agency is linking communities in Northeastern Illinois by providing safe, reliable, and efficient commuter service.<p><br></p>Engineering is responsible for building and maintaining the majority of Metra’s fixed assets, such as buildings, stations, bridges, track, electrical, telecommunications and signal systems. The Engineering Department also monitors the condition of and assists in building and maintaining the fixed assets on the freight lines where Metra trains operate. The Engineering Department is divided into two major groups: Capital Projects, and Communications and Maintenance.<p><br></p>Reporting to the Manager, PTC Engineering, the PTC Systems Engineer 2 supports the long term operations of the PTC system through troubleshooting and monitoring of the system, conducting Tier 2 analysis of PTC events and issues, and responding to end-user calls, and documenting events and issues in the PTC ticketing system.<p><br></p>The Primary Duties include: Provide support and assist personnel experiencing issues with the system including initializing equipment on-board trains, installing wayside software and equipment, and creating bulletins and train IDs.<p><br></p>Analyze and clearly, concisely, and accurately document situations, events, and issues of the system.<p><br></p>Perform root cause analysis of events and issues and make recommendations to prevent future occurrences.<p><br></p>Work with other departments to improve operational support, trouble shooting methodologies, and documentation processes to decrease delays and increase system performance.<p><br></p>Utilize best practices for configuration management and quality assurance in maintaining the system.<p><br></p>This position is subject to random drug and/or alcohol testing.<p><br></p><strong>Candidates can expect salary offers that range from <u>the minimum to the mid-point</u> of the salary range.</strong> Metra provides full pay ranges so candidate can consider their growth potential.<p><br></p>Metra is a railroad employer subject to the provisions of the Railroad Retirement Tax Act, not the Social Security Administration.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree or in lieu of degree, a combination of education and experience that equals four years in Information Technology or Engineering with an emphasis on system testing, maintenance, or root cause analysis.</li><li> In addition to #1, must have three years experience in a technical help desk or end user support facility with focus on Tier 2 and root cause analysis of digital components and systems.</li><li> Good knowledge of:</li><li>software, computers, operating systems (Red Hat enterprise Linux, Microsoft), data communications transports, data security, and networking technologies.</li><li>the root cause analysis process. </li><li> Good:</li><li>verbal and written communication skills. </li><li>problem solving, analytical, and organizational skills. </li><li> Skill navigating enterprise applications.</li><li> Ability to:</li><li>work well with employees at all levels of the organization as well as contractors. </li><li>apply analytical decision-making principles in resolving systems problems. </li><li>work in a fast-paced environment.</li><li> Must:</li><li>be proficient in Microsoft 365. </li><li>possess and maintain a valid driver's license and be able to operate a vehicle.</li><li>be available to work flexible hours in the early morning, late afternoon, evenings, or weekends.</li><li> Willing to work occasional Holidays.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferences</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience working in the transportation industry.</li></ul><p><br></p>On May 11, 2023, both the state of IL and the federal government will put an end to the COVID-19 emergency measures. Effective May 11, 2023, Metra's COVID vaccine requirements will be suspended until further notice.<p><br></p>Please note: Regardless of any state laws that legalize marijuana, Metra prohibits applicants and employees’ use or possession of marijuana (or marijuana paraphernalia), or having detectable amounts of marijuana in their bodies, including synthetic and/or non-synthetic substances such as THC for any reason for preemployment screening purposes, while on duty, subject to duty, on Metra property, or in Metra work equipment and vehicles.<p><br></p>Metra is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. It is our policy to fill vacant positions with qualified candidates without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, gender identity, disability, or any protected categories, assuming an individual can perform the essential functions of the job with or without accommodation.

title: Salesforce Developer
description: Job Summary: Seeking an experienced senior-level desktop support technician with enterprise expertise in the physical and remote supporting and troubleshooting of desktop applications, including root cause analysis, trending, technical documentation, and evaluating and providing solutions within corporate standards. Experience with VMWare Workspace ONE, SCCM, operating system migrations with Windows 7(x32/x64)/10/11, application compatibility, virtualization, Microsoft Office 2016/2019/O365 including Outlook, Active Directory, Group Policy Objects (GPOs), and browsers (Edge, Chrome, Firefox). Understanding of broad infrastructure technology concepts around software, hardware, networking, applications, end-user interfaces, virtualization, and business continuity.Key Duties:Liaise between Endpoint Engineering and provide technical support to end users and Technical Support teams (Service Desk, Field Services teams, Exec Support).Provide technical support for escalated issues reported during the SCCM to Workspace ONE migration (BETA and Prod).Track all escalations and provide reporting to indicate the types of issues being escalated and scope for each.Provide reporting via SharePoint, PowerBI, Spotfire, or another similar tool.Create documentation on how to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues.Work closely with Endpoint Engineering teams with migrating applications and profile solutions from SCCM to Workspace ONE.Knowledge/Skills – Required:VMWare Workspace ONEEndpoint Configuration Manager (SCCM)Active DirectoryGroup PolicyWindows 10, Windows 11Browsers (Edge, Chrome, Firefox)Communication Skills- The ability to communicate verbally and in writing with all levels of employees and management, capable of successful formal and informal communication at the appropriate level.Teamwork - Works well in a collaborative setting, acting as a positive team member by contributing to discussions, developing, and maintaining both formal and informal relationships enterprise-wide, defines success in terms of the entire team through mentoring and knowledge transfer.Technical Expertise - Demonstrates a commitment to increasing knowledge and skills in providing architecture, engineering and operations direction and support of end user device management in a large enterprise, keeping up to date on technical developments and industry practices.Demonstrated success in managing complex technical projects that require innovative solutionsDemonstrated success in delivering results on complex technical challenges including strong investigative and problem-solving skills System Engineer

title: MS Engineer - Security
description: CannonDesign has an exciting opportunity for an Applications Developer based in our Chicago, IL office. Take a look at the description below. If you think your skills and experience make you a good match for this position, we’d love to hear from you. We’re looking for creative, curious, empathetic people to join our Living-Centered Design movement.<br><br><strong>About Our Firm<br><br></strong>CannonDesign is an integrated design solutions firm focused on helping people continuously flourish. Whether designing for innovations in health, new scientific discoveries, equity in education or the next big idea in business, we use our Living-Centered Design approach to help organizations realize widespread change. Our ability to design transformational places, plans and strategies is why Fast Company named us a World Changing Company and one of the most innovative design firms in the world.<br><br><strong>About The Role<br><br></strong>As a member of the Technology team, you will collaborate with your colleagues to create sustainable, scalable applications. Working in the Microsoft stack using .NET Core, Entity Framework, Azure DevOps and similar, you will take applications from conceptualization to deployment and continue to support them thereafter. You will be working alongside – and mentored by – senior developers and given all tools and opportunities necessary for personal growth.<br><br><strong>What You Will Do<br><br></strong><ul><li>Review of projects with managers to ensure quality, efficient and profitable project performance, and implementation. </li><li>Collaborate with Project/Product management, Designers, and Engineers in an agile environment. </li><li>Conduct code reviews with programming peers. </li><li>Keep up with evolving tech trends and best practices. </li><li>Analyze end-user needs and design, test, and develop software to satisfy demand. </li><li>Other duties as assigned. <br><br></li></ul><strong>About Your Qualifications<br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science, or related field preferred. </li><li>Minimum of 4 years’ experience in web and/or mobile application development</li><li>Must be able to demonstrate history of successful project delivery. </li><li>Familiarity with Agile development methodology. </li><li>Experience with C#, .NET Framework, and Entity Framework. </li><li>Experience with MSSQL. </li><li>Experience with developing REST APIs. </li><li>Experience with Azure and Azure DevOps. </li><li>Experience using HTML and CSS. </li><li>Experience using Git. <br><br></li></ul>As a Federal Contractor, CannonDesign is required to comply with President Biden's Executive Order 14042. Therefore, as a condition of employment, all employees must provide proof of receipt of a full COVID-19 vaccination unless qualified for a valid medical or religious accommodation.<br><br><strong>About Working Here<br><br></strong><ul><li>We are relentless in our pursuit of client adoration (not simply satisfaction). Consistent delivery of the best service is what we are about. </li><li>We are committed to ensuring our practice is equitable for all employees, representative of the communities around us – and focused on the future of design. We advocate for equity, diversity, and inclusion efforts through the leadership of our DEI Council, Employee Resource Groups and other community advocacy initiatives. </li><li>We’re about communication and transparency here. If you want to talk to someone about an idea you have, or a challenge that needs addressing, we’re ready for you. <br><br></li></ul>For a general overview of our benefits, please visit our careers page at www.cannondesign.com/careers/<br><br><em>Please note that candidates can only apply to our positions on our company Careers site. It's not uncommon for scammers to create positions that look legitimate on other sites; never enter your information or apply for CannonDesign positions on any platform. Should an issue arise that you feel we should be aware of, please contact us. Please provide your resume and portfolio when applying.<br><br></em>As a condition of employment, all employees are expected to complete mandatory training, including compliance training, within required timeframes and adhere to our internal policies and our Code of Conduct.<br><br>CannonDesign recognizes the value of diversity in our workforce. We are committed to equal opportunity. We consider all qualified employment applicants without regard to race, religion, color, gender, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, partnership status, protected veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. Individuals who hold legal work authorization applicable to employment at CannonDesign in the United States will be considered without regard to citizenship/alienage.

title: System Engineer
description: <strong>Organization- Hyatt Corporate Office, Chicago</strong><p><br></p><strong>Summary</strong><p><br></p><strong>The Opportunity </strong><p><br></p>Hyatt seeks an enthusiastic platform operations engineer to join our Platform Operations department. In this role, you will be collaborating closely with the broader IT teams, where you’ll be instrumental in continuing to make Hyatt a leading hospitality company. You will be part of a team that is passionate about diversity, equity, and inclusion, committed to nurturing curiosity and new skills and building connections across the organization with stakeholders, colleagues, and guests.<p><br></p><strong>Who We Are</strong><p><br></p>At Hyatt, we believe in the power of belonging and creating a culture of care, where our colleagues become family. Since 1957, our colleagues and guests have been at the heart of our business and helped Hyatt become one of the world's best and fastest-growing hospitality brands. Our transformative growth and the addition of new hotels, brands, and business lines can open the door for exciting career and growth opportunities for our colleagues.<p><br></p>As we continue to grow, we never lose sight of what’s most important: People. We turn trips into journeys, encounters into experiences, and jobs into careers.<p><br></p><strong>Why Now?</strong><p><br></p>This is an exciting time to be at Hyatt. We are growing rapidly and are looking for passionate changemakers to be a part of our journey. The hospitality industry is resilient and continues to offer dynamic opportunities for upward mobility, and Hyatt is no exception.<p><br></p><strong>How We Care For Our People</strong><p><br></p>Our purpose sets us apart—to care for people so they can be their best. Every business decision is made through the lens of our purpose, and it informs how we have and will continue to support each other as members of the Hyatt family. Our care for our colleagues is the key to our success. We’re proud to have earned a place on Fortune’s prestigious 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for the last ten years. This recognition is a testament to the tremendous way our Hyatt family continues to come together to care for one another, our commitment to a culture of inclusivity, empathy, and respect, and making sure everyone feels like they belong.<p><br></p><strong>We’re proud to offer exceptional corporate benefits which include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Annual allotment of free hotel stays at Hyatt hotels globally</li><li>Flexible work schedule and location</li><li>Work-life benefits including well-being initiatives such as a complimentary Headspace subscription, and a discount at the on-site fitness center</li><li>A global family assistance policy with paid time off following the birth or adoption of a child as well as financial assistance for adoption</li><li>Paid Time Off, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K with company match</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion</strong><p><br></p>Our success is underpinned by our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and we are committed to diversity across the board—from whom we hire and develop, the organizations we support, and whom we buy from and work with.<p><br></p>Being part of Hyatt means always having space to be you. Our global teams are a mosaic of cultures, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, and identities. We constantly strive to reflect the world we care for with teams that achieve and grow together. To learn more about our commitments to DE&amp;I, please visit the Why Hyatt section of the Hyatt career page.<p><br></p><strong>Who You Are</strong><p><br></p>As our ideal candidate, you understand the power and purpose of our Culture of Care and embody our core values of Empathy, Inclusion, Integrity, Experimentation, Respect, and Well-being. You enjoy working with others, are results-driven, and are looking for a variety of opportunities to develop personally and professionally.<p><br></p><strong>The Role </strong><p><br></p>Primary responsibilities include providing technical support and maintenance of containers on Kubernetes. The ideal person for this position is skilled and passionate about solving technical problems while also focusing on the guest and colleague experience. The Platform Operations team is responsible for the daily support and maintenance of the Hyatt.com production and test environments. The team ensures Hyatt.com is operating within expected page response time, error rates, and availability. Team members report incidents and problems to both internal Hyatt Business and Product Owners as well as external vendors. Platform Operations works closely with the development team and third-party vendors to identify and resolve critical production issues. Also, the team works with the Platform Engineering team on test and production deployments using Agile methodologies. Team members collaborate to establish new technical operational strategies in cooperation with hosting vendors and internal technology teams. Individuals with an “automate everything” mentality will thrive in Platform Operations, where there is a strong push to automate operational procedures, deployments, and repeatable tasks.<p><br></p><ul><li>Manage and tune docker containers and Kubernetes pods/deployments</li><li>Assist development in troubleshooting issues with containers</li><li>Conduct root cause analysis in close collaboration with the development and engineering team</li><li>Provide Tier 3 Production 24x7 on-call support (rotation) supporting various technologies</li><li>Implement, and measure operational strategies to improve site reliability and availability</li><li>Remediate all security vulnerabilities pertaining to products managed by the team</li><li>Support software releases using established automated procedures</li><li>Automate repeatable and frequent operational processes and procedures</li><li>Participate in Change, Incident, and Problem management</li><li>Foster a culture of deep learning through blameless post-mortems to improve the shared goal of reliability across services</li><li>Improve and document operational and troubleshooting procedures</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Experience Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years of hands-on experience managing and troubleshooting issues on Docker and Kubernetes.</li><li> Hands-on experience handling infrastructure as code using Ansible, helm charts, etc.</li><li>2+ years’ experience with Nginx or a similar tool.</li><li>2+ years’ experience with supporting modern web and mobile application environments.</li><li>2 years’ experience tuning and troubleshooting application performance for memory, CPU, thread usage, and database pooling</li><li>2 years’ experience with Bash, Python, Perl, or similar scripting language.</li><li>1-2 years’ experience with any APM tool like Datadog</li><li>1-2 years’ experience with any log aggregator tool</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience Preferred:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience Salt Stack or similar configuration management tools.</li><li>Working knowledge of incident, problem, and change management best practices.</li><li>Strong business and technical acumen being able to effectively communicate with others</li><li>Strong organizational and prioritization skills.</li><li>Working knowledge of CDN, Load balancers, and DNS</li></ul><p><br></p>The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way to be construed as all-encompassing. Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary.<p><br></p><strong>We welcome you:</strong><p><br></p>Research shows that women, people of color, and other historically excluded groups, tend to apply to jobs, only if they meet all the listed job qualifications. Unsure if you check every box, but feeling inspired to enhance your career? Apply. We’d love to consider your unique experiences and how you could make Hyatt even better.

title: PTC Systems Engineer 2
description: <ul><li>Description:*</li><li>Profile new applications with customers, including functional specifications, project timelines and cost targets.</li><li>Plan and modify product configurations to meet customer needs.</li><li>Generate price quotations for customers, including technical submittal information.</li><li>Troubleshoot and provide technical support for chillers in the field</li><li>Select and source major components for custom designs with Engineering.</li><li>Support Engineering and Manufacturing in the design and assembly process to ensure all customer</li><li> requirements are met.</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:*</li><li>Bachelors of Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Chemical).</li><li>Minimum 5-7 years of work experience</li><li>Computer Skills: proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook and Power Point. Aptitude to learn ERP system</li><li> and processes.<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. title: System Engineer
description: Develop data-driven solutions with Cloud based technologies to meet evolving business needs. Deliver impactful, scalable, and highly performant Data solution to our customers based in US, UK, Canada and India based customersProvide technical design and develop Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) applications that interface with Datametica’s customer applications. Lead and implement data driven solutions and collaborate with larger development teamsLead and Develop Test Strategy, Test Plan, Test Cases to test the cloud based solutions Core ResponsibilitiesDrive Analysis to understand and meet all technical specifications and business requirements according to the established designs.Work extensively to develop Test Strategy, Test Plan, Test Cases to test the cloud based solutionsAnalyse Issues identified during Testing phase, propose solutions to fix the issues. Provide senior-level technical consulting to peer data engineers during design, development and testing for highly complex and critical data projects. Work extensively within the Cloud ecosystem and migrate data from Teradata/Netezza/ similar on-Premise Big Data platforms to Cloud based platforms like Big Query, SQLKey Role RequirementsBachelor's degree in computer science, or related fieldApprox 8+ years of experience with a proven experience in data platform and big data engineeringHands-on Experience in SQL is mandatory. Quickly learning skills to adapt Google Cloud Platform cloud native SQL (Bigquery).Hands-on experience in Python is mandatory. Experience in using a Jupyter notebook is a plus.Hands on and deep experience working with Google Data Products (e.g. BigQuery, Dataflow, Cloud Composer, GCS etc.).Willingness to continuously learn &amp; share learnings with others Capability to collaborate with stakeholders and project leaders to understand requirements, deliverables, and set expectations on tasks that you will be responsible for Ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment Ability to work with business stakeholders and IT team to understand the requirements and quickly translate them into workable solutions using Python and SQL (Bigquery)Experience working in an agile and collaborative team environment Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation and professional speaking skills Proven problem-solving skills and attention to detail with a commitment to excellence and high standards<p><br></p>Google Cloud Platform Data Engineer

title: Applications Developer
description: As the largest life insurance premium finance company in the country, Wintrust Life Finance provides customized financing solutions to qualified borrowers seeking to finance their life insurance premiums. Our financing solutions have supported numerous planning structures, including traditional wealth transfer, key-man insurance, buy-sell arrangements, split dollar arrangements, term alternatives, charitable giving, income replacement strategies, and more. Wintrust Life Finance is a subsidiary of Wintrust, a financial services company with more than $50 billion in assets.<p><br></p><strong>Why join us?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>An award-winning culture! We are rated a Top Workplace by the Chicago Tribune (past 8 years) and Employee Recommended award by the Globe &amp; Mail (past 6 years)</li><li>Competitive pay </li><li>Comprehensive benefit package including medical, dental, vision, life, a 401k plan with a generous company match and tuition reimbursement to name a few</li><li>Family-friendly work hours</li><li>With 175+ community bank locations, we offer opportunities to grow and develop in your career</li><li>Promote from within </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Why join this team?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>We work in a dynamic environment that promotes creativity and problem-solving </li><li>Teamwork and collaboration are a critical aspect of the quality control environment </li><li>Ability to manage multiple tasks and meeting deadlines</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Performs post booking review and verification of the loan system data for new business and renewals, against the documentation and credit approval. </li><li>Reviews loan maintenance entered for all life loans by loan analyst and/or loan officers.</li><li>Verifies maintenance affecting a loan processed by someone outside of Loan Operations. </li><li>Documents, communicates and follows-up on loan corrections needed as result of the quality control process. Provides reporting on QC items.</li><li>Maintains timely follow up and daily productivity of assigned workload.</li><li>Assist department with special tasks and roll out of new projects.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of 2 years of experience within a quality control role in the banking/financial services industry. (Required)</li><li>Requires working knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Excel</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication</li><li>Ability to effectively communicate with all levels within the organization</li><li>Strong attention to detail, excellent time management skills, ability to work with others, willingness to learn new concepts, adaptable to frequent change and strong sense of ownership</li><li>Bachelor’s degree preferred</li></ul><p><br></p>#LI -HYBRID<p><br></p>From our first day in business, Wintrust has been proud to serve a variety of unique communities and people from all walks of life. title: Application Engineer
description: Job Description: Directs, prepares, designs, codes, tests, debugs, and maintains complex computer programs Under general direction, formulates and defines system scope and objectivesWorks with users to support business applications, and investigate operational problems/system requirementsDevises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating time, and form of desired resultsRefines business requirements from which programs will be writtenDesigns, codes, tests, debugs, and documents those programsResponsible for completion of development projectsSolves user inquiries that arise during day-to-day operationDevelops business cases, requirements and performance metricsDesire to work primarily on the database level as well as working on full stack developer projectsComply with internal IT and Sarbanes Oxley requirements<p><br></p>Qualifications: Required: Bachelor's degree and 5 years related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience is required.Competent to work at the highest technical level of all phases of applications systems analysis and programming activities. Preferred Skills/Experience:Microsoft SQL Server 2016 and beyondStored procedures, T-SQL, temp tables, database performance tuningDevelopment experience in C# and the .NET Framework 4.x or .NET CoreSOLID principles and design patternsMicrosoft SSRS and Microsoft SSISData warehouse concepts and design patterns including star schema and snowflake database design, ETL processingExperience with Microsoft Power BIExperience with Microsoft Team Foundation Server (TFS)Desired:Experience with LINQ, Entity FrameworkWeb Services including ASP.NET, MVC, WCF and Web APIDevelopment experience using C#, .NET Framework 4.8 and above and .NET Core 3.0Experience with automated unit testing and test-assisted developmentExperience with AzureThird party controls such as Telerik or DevExpressExperience with agile software development methodologiesUnderstanding of systems development and project delivery life cyclesExperience with common development design patterns such as Factory, Repository, Singleton, IOC, and StrategyExperience with Domain Driven DesignKnowledge of Sarbanes Oxley requirementsWork Traits:Strong applications analysis and issue resolution (trouble shooting) skills<p><br></p>Strong user and client relationship management skills Excellent written and oral communications with ability to work effectively and provide feedback to senior level managers and vendors Self-starter with strong work ethic and ability to excel in fast paced, high demand environment Competent to work at the highest technical level of all phases of applications systems analysis and programming activitiesProven ability to independently manage tasks and priorities, accurately estimate work and meet deadlinesCommitment to quality and excellent customer service to end users Senior SQL Developer

title: Google Cloud Platform Data Engineer
description: Prestigious Financial Institution is currently seeking an Enterprise Monitoring Engineer with Splunk experience . Candidate will provide services related to Enterprise Systems Monitoring. This includes Infrastructure, Application and logging.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Write automation scripts using common automation tools such as Ansible, Terraform, Python, or Shell Scripting</li><li>Interface with 3rd party applications using API s</li><li>Design and develop enterprise monitoring solutions for cloud environments</li><li>Design and develop enterprise monitoring solutions for microservices technologies</li><li>Administer log ingestion tools such as Splunk</li><li>Administer Infrastructure monitoring tools such as LogicMonitor</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>System administration and change management practices</li><li>Advanced knowledge of Splunk administration</li><li>Experience Scripting and coding against API s</li><li>Solid understanding of network technologies</li><li>Experience with cloud native applications</li><li>Experience with technologies used to support microservices.</li></ul>

title: Application Engineer
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - Work from anywhere (TimeZone: CST | Partial overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $50 – $70/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 20h/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>Portfolio of projects: assigned and passion projects to show. We want to see what kind of ideas a person is playing with and how they thought about the execution process and what they learned.</li><li>Curious</li><li>Deep thinker</li><li>High integrity</li><li>Can handle uncertainty and can concretize loose specifications</li><li>Long-term thinker. </li><li>Thoughtful </li></ul> <strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong>Decentralized autonomous organizations (DAO) don’t exist, but they should. Our client hope to build the first of many sustainable DAOs. No blockchain has figured this out. The world-wide web was supposed to be decentralized, but is now more centralized than ever before. Without governance and cultural considerations, technologies are easily abused and used in ways absolutely antithetical to the design intent over time. Their techno-social solution addresses the problem of what it would take to actually create a decentralized Web 3.0.<br><br><strong>First Deliverables:<br></strong><ul><li>1: Architecture finalization [April] </li><li>2: Iterative buildout of prototype in a closed network and desktop browser only. [Mid-June] </li><li>3: Iterative buildout of prototype in a open network and upgradability mechanisms. [Mid - Oct] <br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6483<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Application Engineer
description: Remote Opportunity (US)<br><ul><li>US Citizenship Required<br></li></ul>We are looking for an Appian Developer that will be part of an Agile development team with a passion for supporting an Enterprise Level Application. This is a full telework role that offers the ability to obtain a government public trust and DOD level certifications!<br><br>The Appian Developer will provide technical, managerial, and administrative direction for problem definition, analysis, requirements development, and implementation for complex to extremely complex systems in the subject matter area. Make recommendations and advise on organization-wide system improvements, optimization or maintenance efforts in the following specialties information systems architecture; networking; telecommunications; automation; communications protocols; risk management/electronic analysis; software; lifecycle management; software development methodologies; and modeling and simulation. Commensurate experience in IT and in new and related older technology that directly relates to the required area of expertise.<br><br><strong><u>Job Duties<br></u></strong><ul><li>Focus on business logic and process flows, working on the design and development of business logic, process models/flows and UI screens to implement in a BPM (Business Process Management)-based system.</li><li>Work closely with Business Analyst to investigate customers' requirements, prototype business solutions, and validate user story acceptance criteria.</li><li>Coordinate closely with team members to ensure proper implementation of fixes, unit testing, and configuration management.</li><li>Review Appian development and sign off on design and implementation.</li><li>Develop and maintain Appian Business Process Management (BPM) solutions, including plug-in development.</li><li>Develop Structured Query Language (SQL), update data models and implement common database best practices (indexes, triggers, and data structure).</li><li>Unit testing, technical problem determination and debugging.</li><li>Manage daily work in the Atlassian suite of applications (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket and Bamboo).</li><li>Coordinate with DevOps team member to ensure timely and reliable release to customer.</li><li>Ensure software maintains data integrity, security and best practice standards.</li><li>Mentor junior BPM developers to improve capabilities of the team.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related field or equivalent relevant experience.<br><br>5-10 years of experience with programming or web development activities.<br><br>(CASP+ CE, CISSP (associate) or CSSLP) at time of hire or within 6 months of start date<br><br><strong><u>Additional Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Appian software development experience.</li><li>Experience in BPM (Appian, JBoss BPMS, Activiti, Oracle or IBM BPM, Pega, etc.).</li><li>Current Appian credentials as Designer, Lead Designer or Developer.</li><li>Using one or more Appian add-on tools, such as Expression Unit Tests, Deployment Automation Manager, FitNesse test creation, SAIL UI and Smart Services.</li><li>Appian 7.x/20.x version design, implementation and ability to translate software requirements specifications into Appian applications and prototype.</li><li>Knowledge of Appian software design, web development and design languages.</li><li>Understanding and hands-on experience with Agile software development methodologies.</li><li>Strong desire to learn customer business processes.<br></li></ul>#cjpost

title: Software Prototype Developer [Remote]
description: Role: BPM IBM BAW Developers Location: Richfield, MN or Chicago, IL Profile Senior developer who is very technical that will work closely with on-shore lead. They will have their own offshore team as well. Need this person to answer questions for the offshore team if the leads aren't available. More than 50% of hands on technical development. Be able to follow up the next morning and check on work. They want no pause in work. The work has to be continuous with good communication and transition from on-shore to offshore team. The team is already assembled. There is jazz sessions every Thursday. This is an all hands on deck approach. Has had past experiences where people have said they would relocate and then never would. They can only sit in the office in Richfield. They want this person side by side with this person to help with communication and everyone is on the same page. They want this person to help with decision making. Looking for BPM Developer - Needs to have IBM BAW Tech IBM BAW (Business Automation Workflow) 21.0 (Required - deadline is too short to have someone to catch up) Must haves: 10+ years of experience modeling processes using IBM BPM Process Designer, Integration, Implementing UCAs, Ajax, Generic System Services. Strong hands on core Java/J2EE/XML development and with SOA (REST and/or SOAP) Strong hands on experience with Process Designer, BPDs and Coach Framework as a Front End technology. Strong hands on experience with with Process Modules, SCA modules and various bindings, Mediation modules, libraries, message handing, error handling, Human Tasks, BO, SDO, Business Rules Strong hands on experience with REST/SOAP to consume complex enterprise interface solutions. Strong hands on experience with applying governance model, managing releases/ change cycles. Strong hands on experience with CI/CD experience, knowledge of ALM tools Git, Jenkins, Ansible, UrbanCode and other deployment tools. Strong communication skills and the ability to interact with all levels of business users and technical resources. Strong hands on experience working with designers in creating wireframes &amp; mockups. Nice to haves: Knowledge on with DB[SQL Server/Oracle] Programming experience. Knowledge of Java/J2EE. Knowledge of Banking &amp; Financial Services domain. Agile Experience.

title: Test & Validation Engineer
description: Software and Data Integration Developer, Chicago, IL This Software and Data Integration Developer position is a key part of the tech team, which ensures the seamless operation of the firm’s software and data platforms and assists key stakeholders with the development of scalable business processes and automated solutions.<p><br></p>The Systems Integration team has the primary responsibility of developing webhook endpoints and workflows to ingest data and documents from external partners, as well as developing code solutions for document manipulation and internal integrations between web platforms.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have an aptitude and interest in developing and supporting performant, scalable, and automated technology solutions.<p><br></p>The Software and Data Integration Developer will write Python code for things like document ingestion/manipulation and more complex programming tasks.<p><br></p>This is a Hybrid position in Chicago.<p><br></p>Candidates are required to come into the office 3 days per week. Software and Data Integration Developer Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Become an expert on the technical aspects of a variety of platforms utilized by the firm - how the technology works, what issues can occur, how to troubleshoot problems.- Respond to internal stakeholder inquiries in a timely manner and utilize skills and knowledge of applications to answer questions and solve technical problems.- Work directly with internal users to resolve business problems.</li></ul><p><br></p>This may involve being an information resource, extracting data from cloud platforms to answer specific questions or address a specific issue, or implementing enhancements and new workflows into the existing application infrastructure.- Manipulate data tables in Excel; upload spreadsheets to cloud platforms to trigger bulk actions or database updates.- Actively assist in maintaining and administering the firm’s cloud-based services.- Contribute to software documentation, knowledgebase articles, and other support materials; communicate change to appropriate staff both within the tech team and in other parts of the firm.- Programming tasks to customize solutions in platforms that enable custom scripting, such as Tray.io and AWS Lambda.- Develop custom scripted solutions to solve ad-hoc business problems, such as:<p><br></p>move data/documents via API, bulk manipulate documents (trim pages from a PDF, add a watermark, rename files, mail merge).- Manage testing scripts and run manual testing to reproduce reported issues; identify root cause of problems, then develop and implement a solution. Software and Data Integration Developer Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree preferred.- 2-3 years of application support experience preferred.- Experience with Zapier, Tray.io, or another integration-as-a-service platform preferred.- Experience with web automation tools such as Selenium or UI.Vision preferred.- Python programming experience, including manipulating PDF documents.- Software integration experience, ideally accessing medical data using Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR).- Must be able to read, write and speak fluent English.- Strong computer proficiency; adept at learning new software.- Strong diagnostic and problem-solving skills.- Advanced skills in Excel, including pivot tables and xlookup.- Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to communicate in both technical and non-technical language.- Excellent people-skills (outgoing, approachable, motivated to help), including the ability to train end users.- Ability to work independently or as part of a team.- Ability to conduct research into computing issues and software functionality.- Keen attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.- Ability to multi-task and adapt to changes quickly.- Ability to collaborate across functional teams.- Proficiency with programming concepts and APIs. Keywords:</li></ul><p><br></p>Chicago IL Jobs, Software and Data Integration Developer, Python Programming, Zapier, Tray.io, UI.Vision, Selenium, FHIR, Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources, Excel, Pivot Tables, xlookup, APIs, Automation Tools, .pdf Documents, Webhook Endpoint, Workflows, Programming, Programmer Analyst, Software Engineer, Software Developer, Chicago Recruiters, Information Technology Jobs, IT Jobs, Chicago Recruiting Looking to hire a Software and Data Integration Developer in Chicago, IL or in other cities?<p><br></p>Our IT recruiting agencies and staffing companies can help. We help companies that are looking to hire Software and Data Integration Developers for jobs in Chicago, Illinois and in other cities too.<p><br></p>Please contact our IT recruiting agencies and IT staffing companies today! Software and Data Integration Developer<p><br></p><ul><li>M</li></ul>

title: Appian Developer III
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?<br><br></strong>Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. May work directly with clients on-site or provide installation support remotely.<br><br><strong>Working at NTT<br><br></strong>The primary responsibility of the TS Implementation Engineer is to provide technical support to NTT (Ltd) clients. This includes remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs), to install and configure software and hardware, resolve incidents, perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management. The TS Implementation Engineer (L3) is involved in more complex environments for installation, configuration and fault management.<br><br><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution. </li><li>Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties. title: BPM IBM BAW Developers
description: <ul><li>Actalent connects passion with purpose. We help visionary companies advance their engineering and science initiatives through access to specialized experts that drive scale, innovation, and speed to market. With a network of almost 30,000 engineering and sciences consultants and more than 4,500 clients across the U.S., Canada, Asia, and Europe, Actalent serves many of the Fortune 500. An operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions, Actalent launched as a new specialized engineering and sciences services and workforce solutions brand in 2021.*</li><li>Description:* Assists with Installing, configuring, troubleshooting, and maintaining a variety of coordinate measuring machines (CMM), machine tools and accessories.<br><br></li></ul>Assists with identifying analyzing and repairing failures, orders and replaces parts as needed.<br><br>Provides some customer training.<br><ul><li>Assists with the installation and machine maintenance including diagnosis, repairs, troubleshooting, certifications, and re-calibration of various machines at the customer sites to conform to factory specifications and accuracy standards.</li><li>Answers basic customer questions about product features</li><li>Supports basic service calls to customer sites to correct problems involving company products, diagnoses and corrects basic problems, and performs related duties to customer satisfaction</li><li>Assists with technical support to other service representatives and customers</li><li>Ensures prompt preparation and completion of service and expense reporting</li><li>Provides the highest customer satisfaction in a professional manner</li><li>Provides basic mechanical tasks including assembly, disassembly, leveling, diagnosis and repair of issues on automated equipment</li><li>Provides basic electrical tasks including diagnosis, troubleshooting, and repair of control systems</li><li>Complete preventative maintenance and field modifications</li><li>Keeps up to date with administrative responsibilities such as customer service logs and internal service records</li><li>Maintains tools and test equipment ensuring they are properly calibrated</li><li>Maintains daily communications with customers ensuring resolution and proper follow-up to any issues</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:* Minimum 1 year of experience as a service technician (can be from school or working on things at home) Okay with 100% travel M-F Electrical and mechanical troubleshooting low voltage</li><li>Employee Perks: *</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>PTO &amp; Holiday Pay</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>Why Actalent? *</li><li>Actalent is an equal opportunity employer.</li><li>Work with a dedicated career partner specialized in your skill set</li><li>We advocate on your behalf so you get what you want and need out of your job</li><li>Get performance feedback, career advice, and access to ongoing professional development tools</li><li>Build your career and learn new skills through projects as diverse as your curiosity</li><li>If you are interested in learning more, please send your resume to jkowalski@actalentservices.com<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

description: <ul><li>Looking for a new Firmware Engineering position? *</li><li>I have the one for you!* My client is currently hiring for a Firmware Engineer to design, develop, document and analyze new and modified professional medical scale designs. This position would involve designing and developing embedded applications. You would be in charge of selecting and evaluating microprocessors, platforms, operating systems and firmware architecture solutions that meet performance and product cost needs. In this role you would be working closely with other team engineers, product management, and marketing for product development from inception to completion. The last responsibility in this role would be to generate engineering documentation such as software flow charts, functional specifications and test plans.</li><li>Top Skills Details:*</li><li>Firmware</li><li>Microcontroller</li><li>Microprocessor</li><li>Software Troubleshooting</li><li>Hardware</li><li>C/C++</li><li>STM</li><li>TI Chip</li><li>New Product Development</li><li>Embedded Controllers</li><li>Hardware Design Software</li><li>General Validation Experiences</li><li>Software Flow Chart</li><li>Effective Troubleshooting skills and practice experience with system programming</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>PTO</li><li>Paid Holidays</li><li>Experience Level:* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering with 8+ years of experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose.
