title: Hadoop Admin with Cloudera CDP exp.
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary</strong><p><br></p>This role is responsible for applying skilled knowledge to the design and development of embedded applications on hardware platforms. The focus in this role includes creation of technical specifications, application firmware design and development, and support for manufacturing and regulatory approval. Knowledge of basic software development practices and principles is required. An Engineer 3, Firmware must support their peers in day-to-day development activities and be able to troubleshoot platform defects of average complexity. This role will be responsible for both individual and team based software development activities.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Responsibilities: </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and implement application level firmware solutions to meet business needs</li><li>Work with stakeholders to understand functional requirements of systems to accurately develop designs, implementations and test cases</li><li>Design and develop application firmware using best practices that adhere to product specifications using an Agile development process</li><li>Create and maintain technical specifications as related to product development</li><li>Work with senior engineers to implement scalable designs and modular functional blocks that meet product requirements</li><li>Use design analysis techniques such as FMEA or rate monotonic analysis to validate software designs prior to implementation. Ability to accurately document an intended design is critical</li><li>Create unit test cases that accurately test interface functionality and responses to varied inputs both in and out of scope</li><li>Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve firmware defects as found during bench, lab, and production QA testing</li><li>Apply software quality tools such as Lint, Understand, and other static and dynamic analysis tools to verify software releases meet quality and coding standards</li><li>Support regulatory engineering for FCC and other outside agency approval of end products</li><li>Support manufacturing on site during as needed for engineering and production builds</li><li>Manage own work to deliver according to project schedules; be accountable for delivery</li><li>Actively contribute to the adoption of software architecture, best practices, and technologies</li><li>Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect CGI’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Requirements: </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer engineering, computer science, or electrical engineering and minimum of three (3) years of job-related experience strongly preferred; or minimum of seven (7) years of job-related experience as defined above in the Essential Functions section</li><li>An advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>Flexibility to travel up to 10% of time; international travel required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications:</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work within a cross functional teams to create electro-mechanical products, understanding and participation in Scrum and Agile methodology; strong analytical skills; effective communication skills; ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment; object Oriented programming experience; TCP, UPD, HTTP, WebSockets, MQTT or other connected protocols</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

title: Firmware Engineer
description: <strong>Salary: $80k + $1,000/month MVA </strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Downers Grove, IL</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for a Region Solutions Engineer to help support multiple locations. This position will be based in Downers Grove, IL; however, it may be necessary to travel to other offices or customer locations on an occasional basis. Some off hours work may be required.<p><br></p><ul><li>As a Region Solutions Engineer, you will be involved in the technical design, architecture, qualification and presentation of security solutions offered by Securitas. These include the integration of guarding services with access control, cameras, video analytics, remote monitoring services, intrusion detection, and alarm services. You will be required to work with customers to define their requirements, introduce specific technologies which meet those requirements, design, architect, and qualify proposed solutions, create Visio A Securitas employee is always attentive and often notices things that others don't. Their vigilance is necessary in order to be aware of potential risks or incidents that may take place on our customers' premises.<p><br></p>Helpfulness:<p><br></p>As part of an on-going effort to ensure safety, Securitas employees are always ready to help if an incident occurs that requires intervention regardless of whether or not it is directly related to their job.

title: Urgent Needed - .Net Developer - Chicago, IL
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?<br><br></strong>Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. May work directly with clients on-site or provide installation support remotely.<br><br><strong>Working at NTT<br><br></strong>The primary responsibility of the TS Implementation Engineer (L3) is to provide technical support to NTT (Ltd) clients. This includes remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs), to install and configure software and hardware, resolve incidents, perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management. The TS Implementation Engineer (L3) is involved in more complex environments for installation, configuration and fault management.Key Roles and Responsibilities: Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution. Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties. Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution. Escalate complex problems to the relevant third parties. Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation. Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes. Act as coach and mentor to more junior Implementation Engineers and Technicians. Assume responsibility for the co-ordination of the activities of the Engineers, in line with performance targets. May be required to serve periodically on the customer service desk, providing third line telephonic, remote and on-site support and problem management. Included in higher complexity design work, with input to the design expected. Expected to take ownership of relevant technologies according to domain or specialization. Knowledge, Skills and Attributes: Good understanding and appreciation of technical design and business principles Demonstrates project management and administration ability Good project skills which are demonstrated in the execution of installations and other assignments Demonstrate customer engagement skills Demonstrate relevant domain specialist knowledge Good verbal communication skills Client focused and display a proactive approach to solving problems Ability to work under pressure Ability to coach, mentor and provide guidance to team members Good understanding of project management principles Academic Qualifications and Certifications: Computer Science / Information Technology Degree or equivalent together with specialised training in new technologies and legacy systems or equivalent Project management certification Required Experience: Solid work experience in a technical implementation engineering or similar role Experience engaging with clients and conducting presentations Good project administration and documentation experience Report writing experience Basic project management #ownyourfuture<br><br><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?<br><br></strong>Standard career level descriptor for job level:<br><ul><li> Have wide-ranging experience</li><li> Uses professional concepts and company objectives to solve complex issues in creative ways</li><li> Networks with others outside own area of expertise</li><li> Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria to obtain results</li><li> May coordinate others’ activities</li><li> Typically requires significant related experience with a Bachelor’s or equivalent degree</li></ul>

title: Firmware Engineer III
description: <ul><li>Opportunity for join a family-owned established company with a strong culture|Competitive base compensation with bonus potential and growth opportunities<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client is a premier American steel manufacturing and fabrication company, family owned since 1903, and is one of the leading companies integrating software into their processes to improve efficiency and automation. This role is imperative to their continued success as you'll be building out an entirely new development team to handle upcoming greenfield projects.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Collaborate with other developers on the team to produce robust code that moves the dial on projects and development goals.</li><li>Have significant experience working with ASP.NET, C#, .NET.</li><li>Produce solid code without much need to be micromanaged.</li><li>Work on a development team under 15 total, so having an ability to take ownership over your work is key.</li><li>Report directly into the VP of Software Development allowing for visibility and high potential opportunities at the upper leadership level.</li><li>Mentoring more junior developers on the team through coaching and knowledge sharing.</li><li>Be seen as a person first, before a developer.</li><li>Given benefits you're encouraged to utilize, including a generous PTO plan, bonus opportunities, full healthcare, flexible work hours, and a great 401k match program.</li><li>Have an integral part in the culture of the team<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>4+ years experience as a Fullstack Developer.</li><li>Specific commercial experience in ASP.NET, C#, and .NET.</li><li>Understanding of the full SDLC with commercial experience.</li><li>Experience in Greenfield Development and Maintenance.</li><li>Agile work model, experience necessary.</li><li>Ability to architect, code, and mentor while being adaptive between each.</li><li>Experience within the manufacturing space (or related industry) is a plus.</li><li>Ability to debug and rework code to be more efficient.</li><li>Ability to communicate constructive feedback to team members to consistently improve the code and final products.</li><li>A coachable mindset - knowing there is always new and more to learn from others.</li><li>A tenacity to collaborate in problem solving with others, even when working remotely<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li>$135K - $155K (based heavily on experience)</li><li>Bonus potential</li><li>Take advantage of excellent benefits, including health, dental, vision, and life coverage.</li><li>Generous PTO</li><li>Strong and collaborative culture and team</li><li>Flexible Hybrid Schedule</li><li>Location: River North, Chicago<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Daniela Rodríguez Flores<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-052023-6047280</strong>
industry: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Manufacturing

title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer - Professional
description: Sports Betting Company looking for a Front End DeveloperThis Jobot Job is hosted by: Caitlin JohnsonAre you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.Salary: $90,000 - $150,000 per yearA bit about us:We are pushing the boundaries of AI. An exciting new AI company founded with the goal of democratizing state-of-the-art AI. The AI Acceleration Platform optimizes the biggest ML models to be smaller, faster, and cheaper so companies can easily access and scale towards the best performance. Imagine a day where large language models like T5 or GPT-3 are used everywhere - that's our vision. We are a team of ML engineers and researchers helping make ML more effective by implementing and advancing the latest research in AI for AI and hardware-software optimizations.We are a spin-off from research at Harvard University conducted through support of the NSF, DARPA, Intel, IBM, ARM, Samsung, TSMC and others. Started with support from Harvard University Physical Sciences and Engineering Accelerator Award and Harvard Allston Venture Fund, we are backed by executives from top tech companies such as Google, Twitter, Yelp, etc. and VCs including three from the top 10 list.Why join us?We are a spin-off from research at Harvard University conducted through support of the NSF, DARPA, Intel, IBM, ARM, Samsung, TSMC and others. Started with support from Harvard University Physical Sciences and Engineering Accelerator Award and Harvard Allston Venture Fund, we are backed by executives from top tech companies such as Google, Twitter, Yelp, etc. and VCs including three from the top 10 list.Job DetailsRequirements Computer Science degree or qualification in a related field Minimum 2 years of experience related to this role Solid experience in Javascript/HTML/CSS including ReactJS and NodeJS Experience in NoSQL, REST and microservices architecture Proficiency in written and spoken EnglishResponsibilities Develop clean web interactions using React Create and maintain API endpoints integrated with the system Help design and build the tech stack to ensure high system scalability and reliability Manage specification, development, testing and releasing of new featuresYou Are a Good Fit If You Have Extensive experience in designing, developing, or maintaining scalable web services Experience working on large-scale systems and enterprise software Expertise in application, data, and infrastructure architecture disciplines Familiarity with CI/CD tools and deployment processes Understanding best practices and current trends.Strong Pluses Past experience working at a SaaS company Experience working with Amazon Web ServicesInterested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

title: Junior Java Developer
description: <strong>The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?</strong><p><br></p>You will be part of a team managing a VMware private cloud practicing a development first mindset, engaged with cutting edge design, implementation, problem-solving, troubleshooting, and automating day-to-day tasks. Your work will involve solving many challenging engineering problems in a large-scale internal private cloud including observability, monitoring, infrastructure as code, and many other development efforts.<p><br></p>You will collaborate across teams to understand our operational processes and challenges to increase efficiencies and reduce operational burden (toil). These deliverables must provide easy-to-use, secure, consistent, and scalable solutions combining open source and internal frameworks. If you are passionate about solving real-life complex problems and not afraid of learning top of the line technologies, then this is the right opportunity for you.<p><br></p><strong>Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?</strong><p><br></p>Within the first 2 months: become competent with teams supported infrastructure and responsibilities with respect to standard operations. Within the first 4 months: independently handle troubleshooting incidents. Also provide solutions or inputs for project implementation. Within the first 6 months: you will be expected to contribute to our observability, monitoring, auto remediation, and infrastructure as code. After 6 months+: you will be a subject matter expert in one or more areas of our environment, helping drive the design, implementation, and evangelizing the mindset and adoption.<p><br></p><strong>The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Contribute to our observability, monitoring, auto remediation, and infrastructure as code</li><li>Deploy and maintain production environments that requires 24/7 availability</li><li>Ensure our services meet stability, performance, and availability requirements.</li><li>Write technical design documents and hold reviews </li><li>Participate in all team scrum meetings and demos</li><li>Participate in on-call duty rotation</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?</strong><p><br></p>This position reports to Geremy Gibson, Manager for the Cloud Operations team under VPS (VMware Platform Services) BU within OCTO (Office of the Chief Technology Officer). Geremy has 18 years' experience across the software spectrum including: Lead Quality Assurance Automation Test Engineer, Source Control Management Administrator, and Software Development including being the technical lead for VMware vRealize Operations Manager Deployment and Configuration team. He has been with VMware for 11 years and is passionate about software development, design, and helping our team improve the quality and reliability of our services through code. The Cloud Operations team is distributed across the globe and follows the SRE practice of the software engineering approach to IT operations.<p><br></p><strong>Where is this role located?</strong><p><br></p>Flexible/Remote: The location of this role is flexible within the United States. Work can be done from an office or from a non-VMware building.<p><br></p><strong>What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?</strong><p><br></p>You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.<p><br></p><ul><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li><li>Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types</li><li>Generous Time Off Programs</li><li>40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community</li><li>Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities</li><li>Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)</li><li>Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes</li></ul><p><br></p>For US based candidates, the annual pay range (OTE for commissioned roles; Salary for other roles) for this position is: $116,000 - $277,000. The actual offer will be based on the role, location, and individual candidate experience. Bonus, commission, and/or equity may be eligible for this position. VMware offers comprehensive benefits including, but not limited to: medical, dental, and vision plans, company paid holidays, paid sick leave, and vacation time. Additional benefits for this position can be found at https://benefits.vmware.com/. Your talent advisor can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.<p><br></p>This job may require the candidate to travel and/or work from a facility that requires full vaccination prior to entry.<p><br></p><strong>Category : </strong>Engineering and Technology<p><br></p><strong>Subcategory: </strong>Site Reliability<p><br></p><strong>Experience: </strong>Manager and Professional<p><br></p><strong>Full Time/ Part Time: </strong>Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Posted Date:</strong> 2023-05-10<p><br></p>VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.<p><br></p>Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.
description_json: <strong>The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?</strong><p><br></p>You will be part of a team managing a VMware private cloud practicing a development first mindset, engaged with cutting edge design, implementation, problem-solving, troubleshooting, and automating day-to-day tasks. Your work will involve solving many challenging engineering problems in a large-scale internal private cloud including observability, monitoring, infrastructure as code, and many other development efforts.<p><br></p>You will collaborate across teams to understand our operational processes and challenges to increase efficiencies and reduce operational burden (toil). These deliverables must provide easy-to-use, secure, consistent, and scalable solutions combining open source and internal frameworks. If you are passionate about solving real-life complex problems and not afraid of learning top of the line technologies, then this is the right opportunity for you.<p><br></p><strong>Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?</strong><p><br></p>Within the first 2 months: become competent with teams supported infrastructure and responsibilities with respect to standard operations. Within the first 4 months: independently handle troubleshooting incidents. Also provide solutions or inputs for project implementation. Within the first 6 months: you will be expected to contribute to our observability, monitoring, auto remediation, and infrastructure as code. After 6 months+: you will be a subject matter expert in one or more areas of our environment, helping drive the design, implementation, and evangelizing the mindset and adoption.<p><br></p><strong>The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Contribute to our observability, monitoring, auto remediation, and infrastructure as code</li><li>Deploy and maintain production environments that requires 24/7 availability</li><li>Ensure our services meet stability, performance, and availability requirements.</li><li>Write technical design documents and hold reviews </li><li>Participate in all team scrum meetings and demos</li><li>Participate in on-call duty rotation</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?</strong><p><br></p>This position reports to Geremy Gibson, Manager for the Cloud Operations team under VPS (VMware Platform Services) BU within OCTO (Office of the Chief Technology Officer). Geremy has 18 years' experience across the software spectrum including: Lead Quality Assurance Automation Test Engineer, Source Control Management Administrator, and Software Development including being the technical lead for VMware vRealize Operations Manager Deployment and Configuration team. He has been with VMware for 11 years and is passionate about software development, design, and helping our team improve the quality and reliability of our services through code. The Cloud Operations team is distributed across the globe and follows the SRE practice of the software engineering approach to IT operations.<p><br></p><strong>Where is this role located?</strong><p><br></p>Flexible/Remote: The location of this role is flexible within the United States. Work can be done from an office or from a non-VMware building.<p><br></p><strong>What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?</strong><p><br></p>You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer - Professional
description: <strong>Your opportunity<br></strong>New Relic is looking for someone to contribute to our open-source .NET agent software! At New Relic, we help people build better software. Our product, The .NET Agent, observes interactions between applications and the .NET frameworks and makes the interactions visible to our customers to improve their performance and reliability.<br><br>You will be at the heart of New Relic’s best-in-class APM solution, with a focus on our open source .NET agent. Engaging the community to influence the direction and drive innovation, your contributions to our lightweight and dependable data collection software [https://github.com/newrelic/newrelic-dotnet-agent] will directly impact our mission.<br><br>We are excited to consider a remote engineer for this role in the Pacific Standard Time zone. If you are not in the PST zone, we’ll work out a time window that overlaps most of the team’s office hours.<br><br><strong>What you'll do<br></strong><ul><li>Deliver high-quality, performant software with an emphasis on scalability and reliability.</li><li>Learn and grow your skills as a software developer.</li><li>Meet the evolving needs of our software</li><li>Ensure that our software implementation fits with our architectural vision.</li><li>Collaborate with your team, external contributors, and others to help solve problems.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Team Traits:<br></strong><ul><li>We are curious! We seek beyond the surface of the technologies we use and need to understand the internals.</li><li>We deliver value incrementally. We get satisfaction by building tools that help developers get stuff done.</li><li>Accountability: We never say something is “not our problem”. If it’s our customer’s problem, it is our problem, too. We never drop the ball.</li><li>Teamwork: </li><li>We work closely together and believe in the power of pairing. We understand there is a balance between individual heads down and pairing. </li><li>Our “first job” is the job we were hired for (all of the above). Our “second job” is to help others around us to succeed at their jobs. Balancing first and second jobs makes us better, more effective, and happier. We share what we know. </li><li>Being an autonomous team in a larger organization, with all teams working well together, requires strong communication. We write proposals, specs, and retrospectives. We give talks, and we demo the work we are doing.</li><li>.NET expertise: We write instrumentation to help our customers observe their complex systems. We are sensitive to the usage of resources and the performance of our codebase. We learn and maximize our knowledge of the .NET Framework/Core, Azure, IIS, MVC, Entity Framework, MSMQ, WCF, and Async.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires<br></strong><ul><li>3+ years of software engineering experience, primarily in .NET</li><li>Understanding of concurrency and multi-threaded development</li><li>Familiarity with software design patterns, OOP, principles, and practices</li><li>Knowledge of C#, .NET, and the Microsoft environment</li><li>Developed services and web applications</li><li>Continuous integration and deployment experience</li><li>Good organizational skills: ability to organize and deliver on commitments<br><br></li></ul><strong>Bonus points if you have<br></strong><ul><li>Experience with systems programming, CLR, and .NET internals</li><li>Experience with cloud-based software (Azure, AWS, or otherwise)</li><li>Experience with Linux hosted environments</li><li>Familiarity with different datastores (eg.MySQL.)</li><li>Experience working remotely<br><br></li></ul><strong>Interested? Send along;<br></strong><ul><li>Resume </li><li>Cover Letter that answers the question: What is the most challenging thing you've built that you're proud of, and how do you work in a team environment?</li><li>Share your online identity: Github, Twitter, LinkedIn, blog, and portfolio.<br><br></li></ul>We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to help every engineer do their best work, every day, using data, not opinions, at every stage of the software lifecycle. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. What's most important to us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.<br><br>We believe in empowering all Relics to achieve professional and business success through a workforce model called <em>Flex First. Flex First</em> allows us to work in a variety of workplaces that best support our success, including fully office-based, fully remote, or hybrid.<br><br>Read more about <em>Flex First.<br><br></em><strong>Our hiring process<br><br></strong>Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.<br><br>In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.<br><br>We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records based on individual circumstances and in accordance with applicable law including, but not limited to, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.<br><br>Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic.<br><br>New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>Interested in the details of our privacy policy? Read more here.<br><br>Estimated Base Pay Range: $ 110,000 - $ 137,000<br><br>Consistent with New Relic's values and applicable law, we provide the following information to promote pay transparency and equity. The base pay range above represents a good faith estimate of the low and high end base pay range for the listed position. This role may be eligible for the corporate bonus plan (or, if a sales role, a commission plan as defined in the sales incentive plan document), participation in our stock equity plan, short- and long-term incentives, and other department-specific awards that may be applicable. In addition, New Relic provides a variety of benefits to employees. The range provided may also represent candidate ranges and may not reflect the full range or geographic differential for an individual tenured employee.<br><br>
industry: Software Development and Technology, Information and Internet

title: TS Implementation Engineer (L3) (NTT)
description: Systems Integration Developer, Python, Chicago, IL This Systems Integration Developer position is a key part of the tech team, which ensures the seamless operation of the firm’s software and data platforms and assists key stakeholders with the development of scalable business processes and automated solutions.<p><br></p>The Systems Integration team has the primary responsibility of developing webhook endpoints and workflows to ingest data and documents from external partners, as well as developing code solutions for document manipulation and internal integrations between web platforms.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have an aptitude and interest in developing and supporting performant, scalable, and automated technology solutions.<p><br></p>The Systems Integration Developer will write Python code for things like document ingestion/manipulation and more complex programming tasks.<p><br></p>This is a Hybrid position in Chicago.<p><br></p>Candidates are required to come into the office 3 days per week. Systems Integration Developer Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Become an expert on the technical aspects of a variety of platforms utilized by the firm - how the technology works, what issues can occur, how to troubleshoot problems.- Respond to internal stakeholder inquiries in a timely manner and utilize skills and knowledge of applications to answer questions and solve technical problems.- Work directly with internal users to resolve business problems.</li></ul><p><br></p>This may involve being an information resource, extracting data from cloud platforms to answer specific questions or address a specific issue, or implementing enhancements and new workflows into the existing application infrastructure.- Manipulate data tables in Excel; upload spreadsheets to cloud platforms to trigger bulk actions or database updates.- Actively assist in maintaining and administering the firm’s cloud-based services.- Contribute to software documentation, knowledgebase articles, and other support materials; communicate change to appropriate staff both within the tech team and in other parts of the firm.- Programming tasks to customize solutions in platforms that enable custom scripting, such as Tray.io and AWS Lambda.- Develop custom scripted solutions to solve ad-hoc business problems, such as:<p><br></p>move data/documents via API, bulk manipulate documents (trim pages from a PDF, add a watermark, rename files, mail merge).- Manage testing scripts and run manual testing to reproduce reported issues; identify root cause of problems, then develop and implement a solution. Systems Integration Developer Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree preferred.- 2-3 years of application support experience preferred.- Experience with Zapier, Tray.io, or another integration-as-a-service platform preferred.- Experience with web automation tools such as Selenium or UI.Vision preferred.- Python programming experience, including manipulating PDF documents.- Software integration experience, ideally accessing medical data using Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR).- Must be able to read, write and speak fluent English.- Strong computer proficiency; adept at learning new software.- Strong diagnostic and problem-solving skills.- Advanced skills in Excel, including pivot tables and xlookup.- Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to communicate in both technical and non-technical language.- Excellent people-skills (outgoing, approachable, motivated to help), including the ability to train end users.- Ability to work independently or as part of a team.- Ability to conduct research into computing issues and software functionality.- Keen attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.- Ability to multi-task and adapt to changes quickly.- Ability to collaborate across functional teams.- Proficiency with programming concepts and APIs. Keywords:</li></ul><p><br></p>Chicago IL Jobs, Systems Integration Developer, Python Programming, Zapier, Tray.io, UI.Vision, Selenium, FHIR, Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources, Excel, Pivot Tables, xlookup, APIs, Automation Tools, .pdf Documents, Webhook Endpoint, Workflows, Programming, Programmer Analyst, Software Engineer, Software Developer, Chicago Recruiters, Information Technology Jobs, IT Jobs, Chicago Recruiting Looking to hire a Systems Integration Developer in Chicago, IL or in other cities?<p><br></p>Our IT recruiting agencies and staffing companies can help. We help companies that are looking to hire Systems Integration Developers for jobs in Chicago, Illinois and in other cities too.<p><br></p>Please contact our IT recruiting agencies and IT staffing companies today! Systems Integration Developer, Python<p><br></p><ul><li>M</li></ul>
description_json: Systems Integration Developer, Python, Chicago, IL This Systems Integration Developer position is a key part of the tech team, which ensures the seamless operation of the firm’s software and data platforms and assists key stakeholders with the development of scalable business processes and automated solutions.<p><br></p>The Systems Integration team has the primary responsibility of developing webhook endpoints and workflows to ingest data and documents from external partners, as well as developing code solutions for document manipulation and internal integrations between web platforms.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have an aptitude and interest in developing and supporting performant, scalable, and automated technology solutions.<p><br></p>The Systems Integration Developer will write Python code for things like document ingestion/manipulation and more complex programming tasks.<p><br></p>This is a Hybrid position in Chicago.<p><br></p>Candidates are required to come into the office 3 days per week. Systems Integration Developer Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree preferred.- 2-3 years of application support experience preferred.- Experience with Zapier, Tray.io, or another integration-as-a-service platform preferred.- Experience with web automation tools such as Selenium or UI.Vision preferred.- Python programming experience, including manipulating PDF documents.- Software integration experience, ideally accessing medical data using Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR).- Must be able to read, write and speak fluent English.- Strong computer proficiency; adept at learning new software.- Strong diagnostic and problem-solving skills.- Advanced skills in Excel, including pivot tables and xlookup.- Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to communicate in both technical and non-technical language.- Excellent people-skills (outgoing, approachable, motivated to help), including the ability to train end users.- Ability to work independently or as part of a team.- Ability to conduct research into computing issues and software functionality.- Keen attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.- Ability to multi-task and adapt to changes quickly.- Ability to collaborate across functional teams.- Proficiency with programming concepts and APIs. Keywords:</li></ul><p><br></p>Chicago IL Jobs, Systems Integration Developer, Python Programming, Zapier, Tray.io, UI.Vision, Selenium, FHIR, Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources, Excel, Pivot Tables, xlookup, APIs, Automation Tools, .pdf Documents, Webhook Endpoint, Workflows, Programming, Programmer Analyst, Software Engineer, Software Developer, Chicago Recruiters, Information Technology Jobs, IT Jobs, Chicago Recruiting Looking to hire a Systems Integration Developer in Chicago, IL or in other cities?<p><br></p>Our IT recruiting agencies and staffing companies can help. We help companies that are looking to hire Systems Integration Developers for jobs in Chicago, Illinois and in other cities too.<p><br></p>Please contact our IT recruiting agencies and IT staffing companies today! Systems Integration Developer, Python<p><br></p><ul><li>M</li></ul>

description: SharePoint and Power Platform Developer, Chicago, IL We are looking for Microsoft 365, Office 365, SharePoint and Power Platform Developer and Administrator to join an IT Digital Workplace team.<p><br></p>An ideal SharePoint and Power Platform Developer will have diverse years of experience covering Architecture, Development, Implementation and Administration.<p><br></p>We would like to hire a professional with a track record of continuous improvement and delivering impactful projects and enhancements.<p><br></p>This position will work closely with business and IT teams for work related to design, development, and administration of M365 applications, including experience in SharePoint, Power apps, OneDrive, support, and software migrations.<p><br></p>This position is hybrid 3 days a week Onsite and 2 days a week Remote and candidates need to be local in or near Chicago. SharePoint and Power Platform Developer Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Develop procedures to maintain and administer SharePoint environments, including daily monitoring, troubleshooting, and performance analysis.- Design, implement, and configure SharePoint application end-to-end to meet the firm’s business needs and provide solutions to critical architectural and firm-level issues.- Design, develop, implement, and provide maintenance within Power Platform and other M365 applications.- Lead the integration and migration (write scripts) of content from various platforms.- Design custom applications to automate or simplify tasks.- Code, test, debug and document software solutions using appropriate processes, tools, frameworks, libraries, patterns, best practices, and standards.- Troubleshoot any SharePoint issues at the server side, user side, and network issues.- Drive escalation calls for P1 issues and troubleshoot.- Write PowerShell scripts for repetitive tasks, new installations, upgrades, and migrations.- Create infrastructure diagrams.- Troubleshoot connectivity issues due to firewall, load balancer, proxy, and others. SharePoint and Power Platform Developer Qualifications:</li><li>College Degree required.- 2-7 years of experience with SharePoint Development required.- Need Data Migration experience.- Experience with SharePoint 2013, 2016, 2018 and SharePoint Online.- Experience with Active Directory, Load Balancer, DNS, PowerShell, Azure DevOps, IIS, HTML, Java, and Web Logic.- Experience in development and .NET platform (C#, ASP.NET, and PowerShell).- Experience administering cloud technologies such as Azure and AWS.- Thorough understanding and experience with PowerShell scripting for administration tasks.- Knowledge of Web Services and Services Oriented Architecture.- Experience working with Windows servers, including Active Directory.- A proactive attitude to platform enhancements.- Keen attention to detail and excellent organizational skills.- Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate in both technical and non-technical language.- Excellent people skills (outgoing, approachable, motivated to help), including the ability to train end users.- Ability to work independently or as part of a team.- Ability to produce technical and functional documentation.- Ability to troubleshoot and perform unit testing based on scenarios.- Aptitude for continuous learning.- Must be able to read, write, and speak fluent English.- Experience with NetDocuments (NetDocs) is a plus. Keywords:</li></ul><p><br></p>Chicago IL Jobs, SharePoint and Power Platform Developer, SharePoint, Active Directory, Load Balancers, DNS, PowerShell, AWS, Azure, DevOps, IIS, HTML, Java, WebLogic, .Net, C#, Windows Server, Microsoft 365, Office 365, NetDocuments, NetDocs, Data Migration, Programmer, Programmer Analyst, Software Engineer, Software Developer, Chicago Recruiters, Information Technology Jobs, IT Jobs, Chicago Recruiting Looking to hire a SharePoint and Power Platform Developer in Chicago, IL or in other cities?<p><br></p>Our IT recruiting agencies and staffing companies can help. We help companies that are looking to hire SharePoint and Power Platform Developers for jobs in Chicago, Illinois and in other cities too.<p><br></p>Please contact our IT recruiting agencies and IT staffing companies today! SharePoint and Power Platform Developer<p><br></p><ul><li>M</li></ul>

description: Kolter Solutions is seeking a People &amp; Culture Manager, Systems.<p><br></p><strong> Location: </strong> Onsite- Chicago, IL<p><br></p><strong><u>Daily Duties</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Supervises data integrity efforts including corrections, auditing and approvals and trains Systems team members on the impacts and risks of poor data integrity</li><li> Reviews quarterly update readiness materials, communicates immediate impacts to business owners, supervises testing efforts on new functionality and ensures Systems team resources are optimized in quarterly update efforts and all deadlines are met</li><li> Analyzes, designs and recommends system improvements that are in line with business practices and objectives</li><li> Works with subject matter experts to establish business rules related to systems functionality for all new feature implementations</li><li> Attends Oracle customer meetings as appropriate and continually works to build relationships with other customers as well as product teams at Oracle</li><li> Monitors service requests within My Oracle Support for timely responses and/or required escalation</li><li> Conducts monthly audit for all user security changes to confirm required approvals and documentation are on file</li><li> Oversees annual federal and state reporting processes ensuring data is accurate, deadlines are met, and regulation or process changes are incorporated into documentation for future use</li><li> Assist Sr. Analyst(s) in gathering required data for partner record changes and identifying opportunities for efficiency in this process</li><li> Assists in management and troubleshooting of all interfaces, in-bound and out-bound</li><li> Monitors ServiceNow Systems team requests for accuracy, timely completion and necessary escalation</li><li> Lead contact to investigate and resolve escalated client and systems issues ensuring the root cause is understood and preventative steps are identified for the future</li><li> Supervises the delivery of systems training associated with the implementation of new and/or upgrades to existing systems</li><li> Identifies gaps in processes and recommends viable solutions to resolve gap issues</li><li> Focus on continuous improvement/education to expand and develop knowledge and understanding of People &amp; Culture subject matter and People &amp; Culture applications/tools</li><li> Perform other People &amp; Culture and miscellaneous duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Supervisory Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Supervises the day-to-day activities of People &amp; Culture Systems Team</li><li> Coach, mentor, and provide learning opportunities for People &amp; Culture Systems Team</li><li> Supplies appropriate and necessary updates regarding system issues, as well as key releases and upgrades to ensure awareness of new system features and functions</li><li> Ensures People &amp; Culture Systems Team are trained on all relevant firm software</li><li> Assists in the development of goals and objectives of the Systems team to enhance professional development</li><li> Delivers periodic performance feedback and completes annual performance evaluations for Systems team</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong> Education: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree required</li><li> Master's degree preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Six+ (6) years of experience in Oracle Cloud HCM required</li><li> Experience managing Human Resource Information Systems, Applicant Tracking, Sales, CRM, ERP, LMS, performance management type systems required</li><li> Experience managing a team preferred</li><li> Experience in professional services preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Software</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Advanced user of Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Access, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and Word</li><li> Expert user with Oracle Cloud HCM application</li><li> Prior experience or exposure of web-based applications such as SharePoint preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Other Knowledge, Skills &amp; Abilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent oral and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills </li><li> Solid organizational skills with the ability to meet project deadlines with a focus on details</li><li> Ability to create and analyze complex spreadsheets highly preferred </li><li> Solid analytical and diagnostic skills for use in dissecting complex issues</li><li> Ability to successfully multi-task while working independently or within a group environment</li><li> Ability to work in a demanding, deadline-driven environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously</li><li> Advanced project management experience to include effective delegation of diverse and multifaceted tasks to subordinates and colleagues</li><li> Capacity to build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external client personnel</li><li> Ability to successfully interact with professionals at all levels</li><li> Ability to adapt communication style to successfully convey messages and objectives to diverse audience</li><li> Capable of maintain confidential information and matters with discretion</li><li> Expert knowledge of administrator and all supported module functions of assigned HR information systems to ensure efficient utilization of modular functions</li><li> Knowledge related to assigned systems and HR issues which may impact HRIS operations</li><li> Capacity to facilitate efficient and effective meetings and presentations</li><li> Ability to travel (10-20%)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Kolter Solutions </strong> is a leading professional staffing company based in Central Florida. We place highly skilled individuals on a contract, contract-to-hire and direct hire positions at clients nationwide.<p><br></p>Kolter Solutions has proudly been recognized as the "<strong> <em> Best Places to Work</em> </strong> by the Orlando Business Journal and Staffing Industry Analysts (SIA). We are also in the <strong> <em> Fast 50 2020 Fastest growing companies in Central Florida</em> </strong>!<p><br></p><strong><u>We Offer</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Full Health Benefits </li><li> Vision </li><li> Dental </li><li> 401 (k) </li><li> Pet Insurance </li><li> Life Insurance </li><li> Supplemental Benefits such as short-term disability, accidental insurance, and supplemental dental and vision. </li><li> Employee Discounts </li><li> Referral Program </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Kolter Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. ensuring data is accurate, deadlines are met, and regulation or process changes are incorporated into documentation for future use</li><li> Assist Sr. Analyst(s) in gathering required data for partner record changes and identifying opportunities for efficiency in this process</li><li> Assists in management and troubleshooting of all interfaces, in-bound and out-bound</li><li> Monitors ServiceNow assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Supervisory Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Supervises the day-to-day activities of People &amp; Culture Systems Team</li><li> Coach, mentor, preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Software</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Advanced user of Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Access, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and Word</li><li> Expert user with Oracle Cloud HCM application</li><li> Prior experience or exposure of web-based applications such as SharePoint preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Other Knowledge, Skills &amp; description: Job Description A Chicago consultancy is seeking a Fullstack Java Developer to join their team. They work with many well-known Chicago-based companies to support clients on a full technology life cycle from architecture and design to deployments and scalability. The ideal candidate is a team player with strong communication and experience in customer-facing roles. This is a fullstack development position. They are leveraging Java, Angular, Spring Boot, Microservices, and databases like Oracle and MongoDB. Any AWS and DevOps experience is highly valued. This is a 6-month contract-to-hire position with flex hybrid local to Chicago. Required Skills &amp; Experience 5+ years of experience developing in Java 8+ In-depth experience with Angular Strong experience with Spring Framework (Spring Boot) AWS cloud-native experience Hands-on experience with databases (Oracle, MySQL, or MongoDB) Experience building Microservices and RESTful APIs BS in Computer Science or a related field Desired Skills &amp; Experience Consulting experience is highly desirable Infrastructure knowledge with Docker or Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines DevOps understanding What You Will Be Doing Tech Breakdown 50% Java 50% Angular Daily Responsibilities 60% Hands On 40% Customer Facing<p><br></p>Hybrid Fullstack Developer in Chicago<p><br></p>

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: <strong>What Will Your Job Look Like?<br><br></strong>The <strong>Senior UI/UX Designer</strong> will be responsible for the user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design of various digital products. This role will be responsible for working with Product Managers and other UX/UI team members on the design of the product's overall functionality. The <strong>Senior UI/UX Designer</strong> will also develop and conceptualize a comprehensive UI/UX design strategy for company-wide use, and produce high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes.<br><br><strong><u>What You’ll Do<br></u></strong><ul><li>Manage intake, design, and output of all product development initiatives that require UX/UI input, in collaboration with Product Managers and other UX/UI team members</li><li>Manage communications on project status and expectations with stakeholders</li><li>Process complex data and turn it into elegantly designed digital reports</li><li>In partnership with content authors, look for ways to improve design of reports</li><li>Continually look for innovative ways to visualize data, communicate complex concepts, and improve readability</li><li>Lead and collaborate on creation and execution of design and development for new product functionality as business needs arise</li><li>Create conceptual wireframes, storyboards, user flow diagrams, information architectures and prototypes to communicate design concepts</li><li>Effectively pitch wireframes to stakeholders</li><li>In partnership with product manager, develop insight about user behavior and transform findings into actionable product and design outcomes</li><li>Communicate abstract concepts clearly and confidently across different audiences</li><li>Be an advocate for great design practice and adopting new technology, champion customer-centric solutions</li><li>Collaborate with team members including product, development, QA, and data</li><li>Own and drive the UX strategy and planning for new product features</li><li>Advocate for users and user centered design practices <br></li></ul><strong><u>What You’ll Need<br></u></strong><ul><li>High school diploma or G.E.D.</li><li>8 years of experience with UX and UI design projects</li><li>5 - 7 years of experience working with agile software development teams</li><li>Previous experience leading or mentoring junior developers</li><li>Expert level experience with Sketch, Abstract, Zeplin and Adobe Photoshop</li><li>Experience prototyping using Axure, Framer, InVision, After Effects or pen and paper and conducting usability tests</li><li>Experience using data to inform design and product decisions as well as optimize and iterate to improve performance</li><li>Experience with a variety of UI design patterns including Google material design and iOS human interface guidelines<br></li></ul><strong>Even better if you have...<br></strong><ul><li>Advanced skills in the following: User Centered Design methodologies; creating mock-ups and prototypes at varying levels of fidelity; UI design, including current industry best-practice in UI standards, and Accessibility requirements, for web and mobile</li><li>Experience with web and mobile design accessibility standards (Section 508 Compliance, WCAG 2.1+, etc.) for users with visual and cognitive disabilities a plus</li><li>Strong design and typographic skills with a visual aptitude (color theory, and layout)</li><li>Knowledge of front-end development (HTML, CSS, JS) is a plus</li><li>Knowledge of JS framework (Angular, Bootstrap, React, Node.js) is a plus</li><li>Passion for user experience and design <br></li></ul><strong><u>What’s In It For You<br></u></strong><ul><li>Health and Life Insurance Plans</li><li>Dental and Vision Plans</li><li>401(k) with a company match</li><li>Flexible Scheduling</li><li>Paid Time Off and Holiday Pay</li><li>Maternity/Paternity Leave</li><li>Casual Dress Environment</li><li>Tuition Reimbursement</li><li>MTM Perks Discount Program </li><li>Leadership Mentoring Opportunities <br></li></ul><strong>Salary Min: $100,000<br><br></strong><strong>Salary Max: $125,000<br></strong><ul><li>This information reflects the base salary pay range for this job based on current national market data. Ranges may vary based on the job's location. We offer competitive pay that varies based on individual skills, experience, and other relevant factors. We encourage you to apply to positions that you are interested in and for which you believe you are qualified. description_json: <strong>What Will Your Job Look Like?<br><br></strong>The <strong>Senior UI/UX Designer</strong> will be responsible for the user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design of various digital products. This role will be responsible for working with Product Managers and other UX/UI team members on the design of the product's overall functionality. The <strong>Senior UI/UX Designer</strong> will also develop and conceptualize a comprehensive UI/UX design strategy for company-wide use, and produce high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes.<br><br><strong><u>What You’ll Do<br></u></strong><ul><li>Manage intake, design, and output of all product development initiatives that require UX/UI input, in collaboration with Product Managers and other UX/UI team members</li><li>Manage communications on project status and expectations with stakeholders</li><li>Process complex data and turn it into elegantly designed digital reports</li><li>In partnership with content authors, look for ways to improve design of reports</li><li>Continually look for innovative ways to visualize data, communicate complex concepts, and improve readability</li><li>Lead and collaborate on creation and execution of design and development for new product functionality as business needs arise</li><li>Create conceptual wireframes, storyboards, user flow diagrams, information architectures and prototypes to communicate design concepts</li><li>Effectively pitch wireframes to stakeholders</li><li>In partnership with product manager, develop insight about user behavior and transform findings into actionable product and design outcomes</li><li>Communicate abstract concepts clearly and confidently across different audiences</li><li>Be an advocate for great design practice and adopting new technology, champion customer-centric solutions</li><li>Collaborate with team members including product, development, QA, and data</li><li>Own and drive the UX strategy and planning for new product features</li><li>Advocate for users and user centered design practices <br></li></ul><strong><u>What You’ll Need<br></u></strong><ul><li>High school diploma or G.E.D.</li><li>8 years of experience with UX and UI design projects</li><li>5 - 7 years of experience working with agile software development teams</li><li>Previous experience leading or mentoring junior developers</li><li>Expert level experience with Sketch, Abstract, Zeplin and Adobe Photoshop</li><li>Experience prototyping using Axure, Framer, InVision, After Effects or pen and paper and conducting usability tests</li><li>Experience using data to inform design and product decisions as well as optimize and iterate to improve performance</li><li>Experience with a variety of UI design patterns including Google material design and iOS human interface guidelines<br></li></ul><strong>Even better if you have...<br></strong><ul><li>Advanced skills in the following: User Centered Design methodologies; creating mock-ups and prototypes at varying levels of fidelity; UI design, including current industry best-practice in UI standards, and Accessibility requirements, for web and mobile</li><li>Experience with web and mobile design accessibility standards (Section 508 Compliance, WCAG 2.1+, etc.) for users with visual and cognitive disabilities a plus</li><li>Strong design and typographic skills with a visual aptitude (color theory, and layout)</li><li>Knowledge of front-end development (HTML, CSS, JS) is a plus</li><li>Knowledge of JS framework (Angular, Bootstrap, React, Node.js) is a plus</li><li>Passion for user experience and design <br></li></ul><strong><u>What’s In It For You<br></u></strong><ul><li>Health and Life Insurance Plans</li><li>Dental and Vision Plans</li><li>401(k) with a company match</li><li>Flexible Scheduling</li><li>Paid Time Off and Holiday Pay</li><li>Maternity/Paternity Leave</li><li>Casual Dress Environment</li><li>Tuition Reimbursement</li><li>MTM Perks Discount Program </li><li>Leadership Mentoring Opportunities <br></li></ul><strong>Salary Min: $100,000<br><br></strong><strong>Salary Max: $125,000<br></strong><ul><li>This information reflects the base salary pay range for this job based on current national market data. Ranges may vary based on the job's location. We offer competitive pay that varies based on individual skills, experience, and other relevant factors. We encourage you to apply to positions that you are interested in and for which you believe you are qualified. To learn more, you are welcome to discuss with us as you move through the selection process.<br></li></ul><strong><em>Equal Opportunity Employer: MTM is an equal opportunity employer. MTM considers qualified candidates with a criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, State, and Federal law. If you are in need of accommodations, please contact MTM’s People &amp; Culture.</em></strong>

title: ServiceNow Developer
description: High-level Job Duties: Evaluate and implement solutions in the application that follow architectural best practices and design patterns. Evaluates and makes a recommendation on techniques, practices, or technologies that would enhance business needs. Consults with partners from systems and business units and Management regarding new techniques, practices, or technologies and the impact of proposed and ongoing projects. Communicates with systems, and partners at all levels in the business unit, and clients about new technology/systems issues. Acts as the technical or business consultant on project development/production health, new techniques, and the implementation of new processes. Lead and Mentor team members on best practices and architectural discussions. Develops or maintains computer programs, including designing, coding, testing, debugging, and installation as needed. Conducts feasibility studies and defines and designs system requirements for complex dataprocessing projects. Prepares project phase reports, including requirements, feasibility, definition and design. Skills Requirements: Core Java, Struts Framework, Hibernate, Pivotal Cloud Foundry/ Public Cloud technologies, Design patterns, Micro services architecture, JMS messaging architecture, Front end web frameworks (JSF, REACT, AJAX) Application servers and middleware (i.e. J2EE, Java, MQ/Solace, Kafka) Enterprise RDBMS Schema and SQL design ( Oracle) Non-relational Databases ( Monga DB, Cockroach DB) Web Services Development Java Struts

title: Java Full Stack Engineer - Professional
description: Cerebra Consulting Inc is a System Integrator and IT Services Solution provider with a focus on Big Data, Business Analytics, Cloud Solutions, Amazon Web Services, Salesforce, Oracle EBS, Peoplesoft, Hyperion, Oracle Configurator, Oracle CPQ, Oracle PLM and Custom Application Development. Utilizing solid business experience, industry-specific expertise, and proven methodologies, we consistently deliver measurable results for our customers. Cerebra has partnered with leading enterprise software companies and cloud providers such as Oracle, Salesforce, Amazon and able to leverage these partner relationships to deliver high-quality, end-to-end customer solutions that are targeted to the needs of each customer. Java Kafka Developer Location: Hybrid (Chicago IL ,3 Days onsite) Duration: 7 Months What you need to succeed: At least 9+ years' experience in building highly scalable, high performance, and highly available back-end applications. Kafka streaming experience Experience with event driven framework Strong Mongo DB skills and experience Development expertise in REST/SOAP/JSON API. Solid working knowledge of NoSQL (e.g., Elasticsearch + Time Series Databases). Unix background with RedHat Spring Cloud Stream preference skill Payment's domain or financial industry experience Experience with large volumes of data Solid understanding of algorithm complexity, parallel/distributed systems, advanced data structures, computer networking, and operating systems. Prior experience working with Agile/Scrum methodologies. Start-up environment experience will be a plus, although not mandatory. Strength in backend service development Self-initiating developer Takes ownership and is reliable Thanks Sai Revanth Email - Phone|

title: Hybrid Fullstack Developer in Chicago
description: <strong>Summary<br><br></strong>This role will work alongside team of diversely skilled team of talented engineers working on building foundational components required by our risk platform, all while enriching and advancing the platform providing sound technical decisions around design, architecture and development. This role must be able to solve problems creatively, communicate effectively within and outside the team and proactively engage in technical decision making to achieve desired objectives. Strong technical and architecture skills, technical leadership and development, Agile expertise, and the ability to effectively execute on multiple fronts are baseline expectations for this role. This role will be a team player and work well with business, technical and non-technical professionals in agile environment. This role, most critically, will support change and improve processes.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Design &amp; Develop software employing object oriented techniques &amp; functional programming paradigm in Java8 or higher versions</li><li>Collaborate with other departments to deliver complex projects which may involve multiple systems</li><li>Review and understand business and technical requirements; translate those into flexible, scalable, resilient design proposals</li><li>Review architecture proposals with tech leads in the firm as well as senior business partners</li><li>Drive strategies and transition plans to deliver target state architectures</li><li>Drive and support development of solutions to complex technical challenges while coding, testing, troubleshooting, debugging, and documenting the systems</li><li>Drive various enterprise level architecture initiatives covering Risk Platform interactions at enterprise level and help flush out reference architecture with POC/Designs</li><li>Drive development of solution / solution architecture on Renaissance Risk Platform project team</li><li>Lead architecture &amp; design tasks supporting development of core infrastructure services for risk platform</li><li>Analyze, document, refine, and maintain architectures that are developed within the team</li><li>Drive team that optimizes application performance through analysis, code refactoring, and system tuning<br><br></li></ul><strong>Supervisory Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>None<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications &amp; Experience<br></strong><ul><li>[Required] Excellent oral and written communication skills</li><li>[Required] 8+ years of Java-based software development experience and must have good to deep knowledge of internal working of Java</li><li>[Required] Spring framework based software development experience</li><li>[Required] Fluent in object-oriented design, industry best practices, software patterns, and architecture principles</li><li>[Required] Strong testing experience with developing test plans, automated test cases, and working with test frameworks; must have development experience where code coverage exceeds 85%</li><li>[Required] Deep understanding of performance issues and multi-threaded development</li><li>[Required] Experience documenting design proposals through clear and comprehensive diagrams, uses cases, and written documents</li><li>[Required] Experience defining and documenting architecture strategies, designs, and requirements across all enterprise architecture domains – business, information systems (applications &amp; data), and technology</li><li>[Required] Good understanding of architecture design mechanisms and steps including logical/conceptual, business and physical architectures</li><li>[Required] 'Get stuff done’ and flexible mindset for greater good of the organization<br><br></li></ul><strong>Technical Skills &amp; Background<br></strong><ul><li>[Preferred] Experience with high speed distributed computing frameworks involving MapReduce technologies like Apache Spark, Kafka Streams, Apache Flink etc. is desirable.</li><li>[Required] Experience in developing cloud native applications running on containers. This experience should include usage of cloud technologies and services like VPCs, Security groups, EC2, RDS, S3 ACLs, KMS, AWS CLI and IAM etc.</li><li>[Required] Experience following Git workflows &amp; working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline, while exposure to Terraform, Ansible written infrastructure code is desirable</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, ElasticSearch, Prometheus, AppDynamics<br><br></li></ul><strong>Certifications<br></strong><ul><li>OCP Java SE 8 Programmer Certification is a plus</li><li>AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate Level is a plus<br><br></li></ul><strong>Education &amp; Training<br></strong><ul><li>[Required] BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field, or equivalent practical experience</li><li>[Required] 8+ year of work experience</li><li>[Preferred] Work experience in capital markets industry<br><br></li></ul><strong>Step 1<br><br>When you find a position you're interested in, click the 'Apply' button. Please complete the application and attach your resume. <br><br></strong><strong>Step 2<br><br>You will receive an email notification to confirm that we've received your application.<br><br></strong><strong>Step 3<br><br>If you are called in for an interview, a representative from OCC will contact you to set up a date, time, and location. <br><br></strong><strong>For more information about </strong>OCC<strong>, please click </strong>here.<br><br><strong>OCC is an Equal Opportunity Employer</strong>

title: HIL Engineer
description: Job Details At Johnson Controls, we transform the environments where people live, work, learn and play. From optimizing building performance to improving safety and enhancing comfort, we drive the outcomes that matter most. Dedicated to protecting the environment, we deliver our promise in industries such as healthcare, education, data centers, and manufacturing. Johnson Controls is developing the next generation of smart and connected. Through a full range of systems and digital solutions, we make buildings smarter. A smarter building is safer, more comfortable, more efficient, and, ultimately, more sustainable. What you will do Come join Open Blue Security team and be a part of our digital transformation journey! We are an exciting "stealth mode" startup within Johnson Controls and our mission it to build the future of "perfectly protected" world. We are currently looking for a Senior Mobile Engineer to be in charge of defining Open Blue's cloud strategy and development activities. You will be working closely with software development and testing teams to design, implement and optimize Open Blue Security cloud native applications and services. How you will do it<p><br></p><ul><li>Scope and document technical work based on business requirements, collaborate with project collaborators to ensure that all requirements are met.</li><li>Design, implement and create loosely coupled, robust and highly scalable applications.</li><li>Prototype applications to evaluate new technologies as appropriate.</li><li>Develop code that is platform agnostic; and where applicable, browser agnostic.</li><li>Work with a large team of engineers in a multi-functional environment implementing high-quality products.</li><li>Shall provide status of their efforts on a daily (morning Scrum) and weekly (Team Huddle) basis. What we look for Required</li><li>All applicants must have bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, EE, Mathematics or equivalent work experience.</li><li>At least 5 years software engineering experience with a solid understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC)</li><li>Must have strong CS fundamentals, software architecture and problem solving skills.</li><li>Highly proficient in native Android (Kotlin/Java) and/or iOS (Swift/Obj-C) development.</li><li>Capable of working individually, or with a large team comprised of multiple fields.</li><li>Facilitation and team-building skills at all levels.</li><li>Ability to influence, train and mentor junior engineers. Preferred</li><li>Master's degree is highly preferred and will count as 2 years of relevant experience.</li><li>Experience publishing app to the respective App Store.</li><li>Experience with React Native and/or React JS is highly preferred.</li><li>Experience building RESTful APIs. #DICE Johnson Controls International plc. is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a qualified individual with a disability or any other characteristic protected by law. To view more information about your equal opportunity and non-discrimination rights as a candidate, visit EEO is the Law . If you are an individual with a disability and you require an accommodation during the application process, please visit here . Mobile Software Developer</li></ul>

title: Senior UI/UX Developer
description: Java, Spring, UI, SQL Looking for full stack Java developers<p><br></p>1.12+ years of experience<p><br></p><ul><li>Will be extremely hands on with design, development, unit test, build/deploy, operational support</li><li>Demonstrated experience in OOAD using established methodologies and notations such as UML and design patterns to create high and detailed level architecture and design.</li><li>Experience using standard frameworks like (not exhaustive and can change as new frameworks emerge and used) Java (Spring, SpringBatch, Maven, Jenkins, Junit, Log4J, Hibernate, MyBatis/iBatis, Code coverage tools etc.), JIRA, Database (SQL, Data Modeling), SOA etc.</li><li>Demonstrated experience with applications servers, development tools, build tools and configuration management practices.</li><li>Experience in working with database (utilizing any of the RDBMS like Oracle, DB2, MySQL or SQL Server) and involvement in data modeling and design of database</li><li>Experience in SQL and performance tuning of the same</li><li>Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced team environment</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills and experience including presentations</li><li> Resource should have good experience at UI, Middleware and Server side programming / development experience</li><li> Unit testing process for each layer (UI, Middleware and Database), any tools being used</li><li> Experience in Design Design patterns</li><li> Code review process / what are the items which shall be verified during code review</li><li> Exception handling how do you implement these at each layer(UI, Middleware and Database)</li></ul>

title: .NET Developer - $30/hr
description: One of the leading providers in market infrastructure and tradeable products is looking for a Senior SDET to join their team! This is a fully remote role, and they are using Python as their main language. They are open for anyone with other languages, as long as they are open to getting into and learning Python. This candidate must have a development background and strong Linux operating systems experience. The environment will also be more focusing on the backend, while Database testing with SQL is also a requirement. Sound like a fit? Apply today! Required Skills &amp; Experience Developer background and heavy QA automation. Linux operating systems experience. Able to work in a backend environment. Database testing experience with SQL. Willing to learn or expand Python knowledge. Desired Skills &amp; Experience Bachelor's or Associate's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or other relevant field. Any CI/CD experience is a huge plus. Performance Testing is a plus. Any certification is a plus. Good communication skills, able to work successfully with other teams. Team player! Able to work well with others and adapt to work environments. What You Will Be Doing Daily Responsibilities 70% Hands On 30% Team Collaboration The Offer You will receive the following benefits: Medical Insurance Dental Benefits Vision Benefits Paid Time Off (PTO) 401(k) Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future. Fully Remote SDET - Must have Python, Backend Testing
